subject: Upgrade Heat
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-09 08:50:09.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/heat/tasks/bootstrap_service.yml', 'ansible/roles/heat/tasks/upgrade.yml', 'docker/heat/heat-api/extend_start.sh', 'ansible/roles/heat/tasks/bootstrap.yml'], 'message': "Upgrade Heat

This could possibly use gold plating in how bootstrapping
operates to use shade rather than the shell in the container.
It is unclear why stack create failed prior to this patch, but
that fact hasn't changed.  I think the heat domains are not setup
properly in the configuration files, meaning that the domain ID
must be created outside of Heat and registered in the configuration
file.  This is covered in Bug #1553565.

Change-Id: I490d4dd68a101f388c0ecb4acab54d5eaa6e314e
Partially-Implements: blueprint kolla-upgrade
Implements: blueprint upgrade-heat
"}]
commit_message:
Upgrade Heat

This could possibly use gold plating in how bootstrapping
operates to use shade rather than the shell in the container.
It is unclear why stack create failed prior to this patch, but
that fact hasn't changed.  I think the heat domains are not setup
properly in the configuration files, meaning that the domain ID
must be created outside of Heat and registered in the configuration
file.  This is covered in Bug #1553565.

Change-Id: I490d4dd68a101f388c0ecb4acab54d5eaa6e314e
Partially-Implements: blueprint kolla-upgrade
Implements: blueprint upgrade-heat

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-02-24 09:18:33.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/rabbitmq'], 'message': "Private attributes usage in rabbitmq script

There are three types of rabbitmq attributes for pacemaker nodes:
	-'rabbit-master'
	-'rabbit-start-time'
	- timeouts:
		-'rabbit_list_channels_timeouts'
		-'rabbit_get_alarms_timeouts'
		-'rabbit_list_queues_timeouts'

Attributes with names 'rabbit-master' and 'rabbit-start-time' should be
public because we monitor this attributes in cycle for all nodes in our
script.

All timeouts attributes were changed to private to avoid unnecessary
transitions.

Also, --lifetime and --node options were removed for attrd_updater as
'lifetime' for this command is always 'reboot' and 'node' default value
is local one.

Closes-bug: #1524672
Change-Id: Ie45ae3a82b8daa35dbdd977dc894877160af457b
"}]
commit_message:
Private attributes usage in rabbitmq script

There are three types of rabbitmq attributes for pacemaker nodes:
	-'rabbit-master'
	-'rabbit-start-time'
	- timeouts:
		-'rabbit_list_channels_timeouts'
		-'rabbit_get_alarms_timeouts'
		-'rabbit_list_queues_timeouts'

Attributes with names 'rabbit-master' and 'rabbit-start-time' should be
public because we monitor this attributes in cycle for all nodes in our
script.

All timeouts attributes were changed to private to avoid unnecessary
transitions.

Also, --lifetime and --node options were removed for attrd_updater as
'lifetime' for this command is always 'reboot' and 'node' default value
is local one.

Closes-bug: #1524672
Change-Id: Ie45ae3a82b8daa35dbdd977dc894877160af457b

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-09 09:50:55.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_network_manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_cluster_changes_handler.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_task_managers.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Use PostgreSQL setup provided by OpenStack Infra

Since commit Id65b7e106d62be92467c18bcb93c9d5da716242f we do not need to
setup PostgreSQL for tests. Now OpenStack Infra provides ready to use
PostgreSQL installation as well as MySQL. This commit stops running
setup code and unblocks gate tests on OpenStack CI.

Also, it fixes random failures of test_force_redeploy_changes. The test
used to consume fake threads, and to check status of created task. That
status might be different and depends on progress of fake threads
(it might be pending, running or even ready). That commit removes usage
of fake threads and improves its quality by checking not only task status,
but actualy deployment data.

Also, it fixes test_assign_given_vips_for_net_groups.

The motivation behind that all-in-one commit is that it's almost
impossible to fix CI due to random test failures. It's the only
choice to get it work.

Closes-Bug: #1554038
Change-Id: I074a2cb4f0e6647c605c8e4449a5beca0c6e9bbc
"}]
commit_message:
Use PostgreSQL setup provided by OpenStack Infra

Since commit Id65b7e106d62be92467c18bcb93c9d5da716242f we do not need to
setup PostgreSQL for tests. Now OpenStack Infra provides ready to use
PostgreSQL installation as well as MySQL. This commit stops running
setup code and unblocks gate tests on OpenStack CI.

Also, it fixes random failures of test_force_redeploy_changes. The test
used to consume fake threads, and to check status of created task. That
status might be different and depends on progress of fake threads
(it might be pending, running or even ready). That commit removes usage
of fake threads and improves its quality by checking not only task status,
but actualy deployment data.

Also, it fixes test_assign_given_vips_for_net_groups.

The motivation behind that all-in-one commit is that it's almost
impossible to fix CI due to random test failures. It's the only
choice to get it work.

Closes-Bug: #1554038
Change-Id: I074a2cb4f0e6647c605c8e4449a5beca0c6e9bbc

Change-Id: Icf653e2b8f84dbaee76d77f99020879d2e5aa4ea
"}]
commit_message:
Security: Disable AppArmor check

Some OpenStack infra images don't have AppArmor enabled by default
and this causes V-51337 to fail. This patch skips the task where
AppArmor tag is checked.

Closes-Bug: 1554654

Change-Id: Icf653e2b8f84dbaee76d77f99020879d2e5aa4ea

commit_message:
Fixed exceptions handling in stacks deleting

When you delete multiple stacks like
'stackA stackB stackC' and you dont have enough
rights for deleting stackB, it throws 403.
In result stackA is deleted, but stackC is still
there.

Change-Id: If2795a4a7a6987da15b5f3f23ee066000e1f2a65

commit_message:
Gracefully fail the backup procedure if postgres container is down

If a user runs `dockerctl backup' when a postgres container is not
running, a backup procedure will crash while trying to generate an SQL
dump file.

We should ensure the postgres container is running; and if it is not
then display an error message.

Change-Id: I6cfff51a836d85b409d57a04183d4c8a52f63c8a
Closes-Bug: #1543107

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-10-05 21:23:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/volume/test_cinder.py', 'nova/volume/cinder.py'], 'message': 'Rollback is needed if initialize_connection times out

During attach_volume operation, initialize_connection in Cinder
is called. If timeout happens during initialize_connection, the
Cinder API unreserve is called by the compute manager and the
volume state is changed back to available.

However, volume could be already mapped to the host on the array.
This leaves the database and array out of sync. If rescan happens
on the host after this, the volume will be visible to the host.
Then if the so-called available volume is deleted, a faulty
device will remain in the host.

initialize_connection is also called in other cases such as post
live migration. The timeout exception during initialize_connection
should be handled and a rollback should be triggered by calling
terminate_connection in Cinder.

Co-Authored-By: xing-yang <xing.yang@emc.com>

Change-Id: I8c195b7cfc6e9b296fc3b8f5ce56bb5e130769e8
Closes-Bug: #1387807
'}]
commit_message:
Rollback is needed if initialize_connection times out

During attach_volume operation, initialize_connection in Cinder
is called. If timeout happens during initialize_connection, the
Cinder API unreserve is called by the compute manager and the
volume state is changed back to available.

However, volume could be already mapped to the host on the array.
This leaves the database and array out of sync. If rescan happens
on the host after this, the volume will be visible to the host.
Then if the so-called available volume is deleted, a faulty
device will remain in the host.

initialize_connection is also called in other cases such as post
live migration. The timeout exception during initialize_connection
should be handled and a rollback should be triggered by calling
terminate_connection in Cinder.

Co-Authored-By: xing-yang <xing.yang@emc.com>

Change-Id: I8c195b7cfc6e9b296fc3b8f5ce56bb5e130769e8
Closes-Bug: #1387807

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-07 14:48:11.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/manifests/mysql.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/database/tasks.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix race condition around initial sync

This change updates the wait for sync to only continue when galera is
reporting that the node has been Synced. Previously we were allowing it
to continue if the state was reported as Initialized as well. This leads
to task failures because mysql may not be ready for access when status
is reported as Initialized. Additionally, this change updates the
database task to be run one_by_one to reduce the race conditions with
the nodes joining the cluster at the same time.

Change-Id: I04956d5b875876b3b0d34a80dff0528bbe7ed76d
Closes-Bug: #1552153
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition around initial sync

This change updates the wait for sync to only continue when galera is
reporting that the node has been Synced. Previously we were allowing it
to continue if the state was reported as Initialized as well. This leads
to task failures because mysql may not be ready for access when status
is reported as Initialized. Additionally, this change updates the
database task to be run one_by_one to reduce the race conditions with
the nodes joining the cluster at the same time.

Change-Id: I04956d5b875876b3b0d34a80dff0528bbe7ed76d
Closes-Bug: #1552153

commit_message:
Drop incomplete monit support

monit suport was enabled over a year ago and then promptly reverted in
Icef28222b978ef90d5f5845acda85685e2c74d3f and hasn't been able to be enabled,
tested, or maintained since. Coupled with major changes in granular roles,
the way we manage services, and test the code should be dropped and is welcome
to be reproposed according to current standards

Closes-bug: 1553411
Change-Id: I61418300ae73bc6db218162096fb4556b939d7b2

commit_message:
Refactoring of code:

1) new snapshot module with code vss,
lvm and part of backup.py -
create_snapshot and remove_snapshot

This module should contain all code related shadow,
vss and any new snapshots.

2) new openstack module with code from osclient,
restore and backup (BackupOS)

This module should contain code related to cinder/nova backups

3) new utils module with code from utils, win_utils,
bandwidth, config, exec_cmd, validator, streaming

This module should containd code related to anything
that cannot be extracted to its own module

4) new test modules - snapshot, utils, openstack and apiclient.

Test scheduler daemon is now located in scheduler module.

5) Backup.py is deleted and code placed to
openstack.backup (BackupOS) and to job.BackupJob

Change-Id: I46194b40b3a65c15b6095cfb7388dcfd30d95997

commit_message:

Change the default install version of RabbitMQ Server to 3.6.1-1.

Additionally, the functional test playbook file has been split into
multiple, more focused, files. Tests to ensure that the expected version

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary VIP assignment

Now VIPs are allocated on cluster creation so unnecessary allocation via
network manager or manual creation via 'create_ip_addrs_by_rules' (which
may lead to random failures of test set; for details, please, see
description of related bug) removed from integration tests for network
manager.

Change-Id: I120b1eb90031b457572290e8e33a3b86e090b294
Closes-Bug: #1547489

commit_message:
Update enable-tls.yaml with new endpoints

A couple of new endpoints have been added, and if they're not in
the configured value for EndpointMap it will cause problems.

Sahara is not added as ssl-enabled because I don't believe it has
been added to the loadbalancer yet.

Note that there is work underway to CI overcloud SSL, which should
catch problems like this in the future.

Change-Id: Ia8a106fd94da7be8675ea84f5fbb9ac959771d10

subject: Fix InvalidTransportURL from neutron.tests.base
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 02:20:32.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/unit/test_controller.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_base.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_ryu_base_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/base.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_openflow_app.py'], 'message': "Fix InvalidTransportURL from neutron.tests.base

Dragonflow test cases are all based on neutron.tests.base.
Neutron basetest class initializes rpc resources that dragonflow
doesn't need and which also causes the exception and gate failure.

Actually, dragonflow doesn't take advantage of any
fake/test resources created by neutron basetest class.

In this commit, all the test cases are inherited from
oslotest.base. As a result, dragonflow doesn't rely on
neutron base test enviroment and we can control and handle
it in the future.

Change-Id: I06753613f3a8f6bd5e980e41a6b91d464f0d789d
Closes-Bug: #1554816
"}]
commit_message:
Fix InvalidTransportURL from neutron.tests.base

Dragonflow test cases are all based on neutron.tests.base.
Neutron basetest class initializes rpc resources that dragonflow
doesn't need and which also causes the exception and gate failure.

Actually, dragonflow doesn't take advantage of any
fake/test resources created by neutron basetest class.

In this commit, all the test cases are inherited from
oslotest.base. As a result, dragonflow doesn't rely on
neutron base test enviroment and we can control and handle
it in the future.

Change-Id: I06753613f3a8f6bd5e980e41a6b91d464f0d789d
Closes-Bug: #1554816

commit_message:
[WIP] Update Neutron repo list to reflect team split.

This change removes repositories which are no longer owned by the
Neutron project team following a discussion in Neutron about the current
structure not working well. This patch depends on one in Neutron where
more details are being worked out around the relationships between
Neutron related projects.

Co-Authored-By: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7a13feb0138290bb73f6f1c74d5783810ec88fa8
Depends-On: Id0e091858a253ae62afdb2f435b53bcafd3efff0

Add networking-generic-switch under Neutron

that allows to work with switches from different vendors.

commit_message:
Add tap-as-a-service repo to Neutron

According to procedure defined in [1], this patch proposes Neutron
to embrace tap-as-a-service within its fold. This project provides
remote port mirroring capability for tenant virtual networks.

For more information on tap-as-a-service:
    https://github.com/stackforge/tap-as-a-service

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/doc/source/devref/sub_projects.rst

Change-Id: I074ad7daacac37388994bad2a4b21e7166ed2b45

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-14 14:01:55.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Remove containers from Nova's mission

In the most recent TC meeting, it became clear, possibly unexpectedly,
that we expect compute resources returned by an OpenStack cloud to be
Bring Your Own Kernel, and therefore for any OpenStack cloud to be able
to run Linux. As it's a distinction that I think we've all struggled
with for some time, making it clear in the mission statement sounds
about right.

The following is clear - it is widely agreed that it is both important
and essential that Nova be able to provide both VM and Bare Metal
resources. "Can run a kernel" seems to be the most succinct way to
express that.

It's not particularly usual for the TC to muck with a project's mission,
so consider this a suggestion that certainly needs Nova PTL buy-in.
However, if the TC is giving this guidance strongly out-bound to DefCore
and the Board, it's only fitting that the TC provide the same guidance
in-bound to the projects.

Change-Id: If243ccc476988cfde2ca9833157230c1cacadf4e
'}]
commit_message:
Remove containers from Nova's mission

In the most recent TC meeting, it became clear, possibly unexpectedly,
that we expect compute resources returned by an OpenStack cloud to be
Bring Your Own Kernel, and therefore for any OpenStack cloud to be able
to run Linux. As it's a distinction that I think we've all struggled
with for some time, making it clear in the mission statement sounds
about right.

The following is clear - it is widely agreed that it is both important
and essential that Nova be able to provide both VM and Bare Metal
resources. "Can run a kernel" seems to be the most succinct way to
express that.

It's not particularly usual for the TC to muck with a project's mission,
so consider this a suggestion that certainly needs Nova PTL buy-in.
However, if the TC is giving this guidance strongly out-bound to DefCore
and the Board, it's only fitting that the TC provide the same guidance
in-bound to the projects.

Change-Id: If243ccc476988cfde2ca9833157230c1cacadf4e

commit_message:
Enable high precision timestamps for syslog

This change updates the logging manifests to enable the high prevision
timestamps for the fuel master as well as the deployed node. Previously
our custom rsyslog template had different logic around the
high_prevision_timestamps setting than what is in the upstream rsyslog
module. This change updates our invocations of the rsyslog::server and
rsyslog::client to enable the high precision timestamps.

Change-Id: I875fa2201fb0c66835c29bb5faadf8e03ae7a794
Closes-Bug: #1554114

subject: Use transactions instead of session.flush
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-04 04:34:06.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Use transactions instead of session.flush

Currently we do session.flush() after deleting objects. It
would be better to use explicit transactions.

This also changes update_and_save and delete to use
'subtransaction=True' as they may part of an already ongoing
transaction(ex. stack soft_delete in stack_delete), and the
flush operation takes place within that transaction.

Change-Id: I8fba68eda63e0e64e8b5e55eab92cf6a8ac5a503
Closes-Bug: #1545577
"}]
commit_message:
Use transactions instead of session.flush

Currently we do session.flush() after deleting objects. It
would be better to use explicit transactions.

This also changes update_and_save and delete to use
'subtransaction=True' as they may part of an already ongoing
transaction(ex. stack soft_delete in stack_delete), and the
flush operation takes place within that transaction.

Change-Id: I8fba68eda63e0e64e8b5e55eab92cf6a8ac5a503
Closes-Bug: #1545577

commit_message:
Specify temporary upload dir for Horizon

By default horizon firstly uploads image to /tmp directory
and pushes it to glance then. Sometimes a lack of free space
in /tmp dir may cause cluster going offline.

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/horizon.pp
	deployment/puppet/openstack/spec/classes/openstack_horizon_spec.rb
	deployment/puppet/openstack/templates/horizon/wsgi_vhost_custom.erb
	deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/horizon/horizon.pp

Change-Id: Iae9f2dddb6fe6d1b350b4467599813e69e01a15e
Closes-Bug: #1496838
Depends-On: I7cb9edd3f6a31b86696d708c525cf8d031642c58
(cherry picked from commit be8a1df57b959d25f4c050feb4279bf1c9d65c1a)

commit_message:
Use PostgreSQL setup provided by OpenStack Infra

Since commit Id65b7e106d62be92467c18bcb93c9d5da716242f we do not need to
setup PostgreSQL for tests. Now OpenStack Infra provides ready to use
PostgreSQL installation as well as MySQL.

This commit drops setup code and unblocks gate tests on OpenStack CI.

Change-Id: I9db01c1dd5dbb72afc2cf19c6d769d0db027caef
Closes-Bug: #1554038

commit_message:
Added skip_check for ListImageFiltersTestJSON if Glance api_v1 disabled

If Glance api_v1 is disabled in running OpenStack, tests
in api.compute.images in class ListImageFiltersTestJSON fail.
Added skip_check with a message for ListImageFiltersTestJSON
if Glance api_v1 is disabled in tempest.conf.

Change-Id: I0695af141955d4c22f30dcd8712504b2cc9f3c59

subject: Adds override for the overcloud node user in upgrade-non-controller
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 11:34:47.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upgrade-non-controller.sh'], 'message': 'Adds override for the overcloud node user in upgrade-non-controller

The upgrade-non-controller.sh script currently assumed there is a
heat-admin user on the overcloud nodes. This may not be the case in
some environments. Allow override by export UPGRADE_NODE_USER=foo
before running the upgrade-non-controller.sh script. The user
must have passwordless sudo priviliges otherwise the upgrade script
will fail.

Change-Id: I33026dff7f89032c43f31eaf03fd15fcb09d0050
(cherry picked from commit 463cf7f922291dc47593caabe5ef4e8b728c2f55)
'}]
commit_message:
Adds override for the overcloud node user in upgrade-non-controller

The upgrade-non-controller.sh script currently assumed there is a
heat-admin user on the overcloud nodes. This may not be the case in
some environments. Allow override by export UPGRADE_NODE_USER=foo
before running the upgrade-non-controller.sh script. The user
must have passwordless sudo priviliges otherwise the upgrade script
will fail.

Change-Id: I33026dff7f89032c43f31eaf03fd15fcb09d0050
(cherry picked from commit 463cf7f922291dc47593caabe5ef4e8b728c2f55)

Some commands overlap...

{

'workflow_show': ['workflow_show_definition'],

'workflow_execution_show': ['workflow_execution_show_input', 'workflow_execution_show_output'],

'baremetal_show': ['baremetal_show_capabilities'],

'task_execution_show': ['task_execution_show_result', 'task_execution_show_published'],

see http://logs.openstack.org/93/290293/1/check/check-osc-plugins/76d5b4a/console.html for an example

This reverts commit f9fb8bf96d4fa9e3719aa867911e757eacc13cd3.

Change-Id: Ib15402e603736a02bab910d32114b8e7f8b88f0f

subject: Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-02 18:11:46.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/config.py', 'glance/cmd/api.py', 'setup.cfg', 'etc/glance-api-paste.ini'], 'message': "Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator

The default values needed for glance's implementation of cors middleware have
been moved from paste.ini into the configuration hooks provided by oslo.config.
Furthermore, these values have been added to glance's default configuration
parsing. This ensures that if a value remains unset in glance.conf,
it will be set to use sane defaults, and that an operator modifying the
configuration file will be presented with a default set of necessary sane
headers.

Change-Id: I5c9560857906d4cfb18c52e062da20c0883fff39
Closes-Bug: 1551836
"}]
commit_message:
Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator

The default values needed for glance's implementation of cors middleware have
been moved from paste.ini into the configuration hooks provided by oslo.config.
Furthermore, these values have been added to glance's default configuration
parsing. This ensures that if a value remains unset in glance.conf,
it will be set to use sane defaults, and that an operator modifying the
configuration file will be presented with a default set of necessary sane
headers.

Change-Id: I5c9560857906d4cfb18c52e062da20c0883fff39
Closes-Bug: 1551836

commit_message:
Make IPDB and IPRoute calls indirect

This patch moves the instantiations of IPDB and IPRoute to the module
level functions to avoid them from reading Linux specific files, which
were preventing Mac OSX users from running the unit tests.

Change-Id: Id6ac74756aab6250bf1fdab817c984a866180d59
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1546400

With the growing number of openstack client plugins, a large list

commit_message:
Add openstack client command overlap checking

With the growing number of openstack client plugins, a large list
of common objects, and the fact that any varity of plugins might be
loaded, it would be hard to stop a command overlap issue before it
get's merged. So, I took a stab at adding this to see if others
think it should be part of the command checking gate job.

Change-Id: Ifb36cb1211283987959e4cb488c5f62ffeb8ff06

subject: Fix logic of test_infrastructure
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-09 08:05:32.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_apps.py'], 'message': "Fix logic of test_infrastructure

The previous commit fixes the root permission requirement on
ifconfig in ubuntu 14.04 distro. But it doesn't work because
'ifconfig' command is not allowed to be executed in default rootwrap.

In this patch, 'ip' command insteads 'ifconfig'. 'ip' is used in
neutron but 'ifconfig' is not.

Change-Id: I702fe3fcb6addf2df1faea0d22a4fbfe8e3169b6
Close-Bug: #1551626
"}]
commit_message:
Fix logic of test_infrastructure

The previous commit fixes the root permission requirement on
ifconfig in ubuntu 14.04 distro. But it doesn't work because
'ifconfig' command is not allowed to be executed in default rootwrap.

In this patch, 'ip' command insteads 'ifconfig'. 'ip' is used in
neutron but 'ifconfig' is not.

Change-Id: I702fe3fcb6addf2df1faea0d22a4fbfe8e3169b6
Close-Bug: #1551626

commit_message:
Heat: allow names instead of ids in templates

This change allows to specify tenants by name in BGPVPN
definition, and allows to specify BGPVPN by name in
BGPVPN-Net-Associations and BGPVPN-Router-Associations.

It also adds heat property constraints for these properties
and for a few others.

The heat documentation examples are updated as well.

Change-Id: I09afb557f0eb02193ef9be8506a0e8e98a98f52c
Closes-Bug: 1551851

commit_message:
Restart containers on network configuration change

Changes to the network configuration need to cause a restart of the
interface for the changes to take place.

We can check the md5sum of the network interface config before and after
the change, and ifup/down when appropriate.

Cherry-pick of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286078/

Change-Id: Ib6b2c167c1718710342fdf61c40fa3fe875f2293
Closes-Bug: #1551256

commit_message:
Restart containers on network configuration change

Changes to the network configuration need to cause a restart of the
interface for the changes to take place.

We can check the md5sum of the network interface config before and after
the change, and ifup/down when appropriate.

Cherry-pick of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/286078/

Change-Id: Ib6b2c167c1718710342fdf61c40fa3fe875f2293
Closes-Bug: #1551256

subject: network: Fix subnet_allocation extension check.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}, {'_account_id': 7350, 'name': 'Jordan Pittier', 'email': 'jordan.pittier@gmail.com', 'username': 'JordanP'}, {'_account_id': 7428, 'name': 'Yaroslav Lobankov', 'email': 'lobankovyv@gmail.com', 'username': 'ylobankov'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16986, 'name': 'Shuquan Huang', 'email': 'huang.shuquan@99cloud.net', 'username': 'shuquan'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-07 14:01:50.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_subnetpools_extensions.py'], 'message': 'network: Fix subnet_allocation extension check.

This code checked for a "subnetpools" extension.  While it's commonly
referred to that way, and may have originally been called that, the
API extension is actually "subnet_allocation".  Nobody has probably
noticed this error as the default neutron jobs run with the
api_extensions configuration set to "all", so all checks like this
would return True.

Change-Id: I646b5e988bc6a9053d5361d81ed4c166fc670c7a
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
network: Fix subnet_allocation extension check.

This code checked for a "subnetpools" extension.  While it's commonly
referred to that way, and may have originally been called that, the
API extension is actually "subnet_allocation".  Nobody has probably
noticed this error as the default neutron jobs run with the
api_extensions configuration set to "all", so all checks like this
would return True.

Change-Id: I646b5e988bc6a9053d5361d81ed4c166fc670c7a
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[Identity] Check return value is None in identity v3 unit tests

take_action() in commands inheriting from Command returns nothing.
So we should assert the return is None in the unit tests of these
commands.

Change-Id: I53eeb88316b2c20882fed97149d55cb04bcb2b2e
Closes-Bug: #1550636

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-02-24 09:39:53.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/pecan_wsgi/controllers/utils.py', 'neutron/api/api_common.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/controllers/resource.py'], 'message': "Pecan: filter items need type conversion

In order for filtering to work properly on GET requests, filter
values should be converted to the appropriate type specified in
neutron.api.v2.attributes.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP.

Without this change queries on boolean attributes, for instance,
won't work as the value to filter on will be passed to the plugin
as a string.

Closes Bug: #1537924

Change-Id: I0a697a01f272f94378928ecc099232e3b2d11f1f
"}]
commit_message:
Pecan: filter items need type conversion

In order for filtering to work properly on GET requests, filter
values should be converted to the appropriate type specified in
neutron.api.v2.attributes.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP.

Without this change queries on boolean attributes, for instance,
won't work as the value to filter on will be passed to the plugin
as a string.

Closes Bug: #1537924

Change-Id: I0a697a01f272f94378928ecc099232e3b2d11f1f

commit_message:
Huawei: Code cleanup

Some codes are useless, we need to clean them up:
1. add_host_with_check have been called at line 1653
   to get host_id in huawei_driver.py, the another
   two are no longer need.
2. Remove duplicated codes in test_huawei_drivers.py,
   also change FACK_XXX to FAKE_XXX.
3. Two constants in constants.py are not used anywhere,
   need to delete them.

Closes-Bug: #1548158

commit_message:
Fixed tempest error due to upstream change

Upstream tempest has dropped the service_client module which we use in
our aodh tempest test. Replace that with upstream formal rest_client in
the tempest.lib path.

Change-Id: Ica5cc39b5ace6d4104b3c724d79f73c25b37bb1a
Closes-Bug: #1554920

commit_message:
Resize: Return to initial state instead of ACTIVE when resize fails

Currently, when an instance fails to resize, the instance
vm_state will be set to ACTIVE instead of its initial state.
This patch fixes it and the vm_state will be set both the
vm_state and power_state to the correct state according to
different scenario.

Co-Authored-By: wangxiyuan <wangxiyuan@huawei.com>

DocImpact:

Change-Id: I19f718ff84012c70e8549125e4a7dfdab1762763
Closes-Bug: #1475112

commit_message:
Enable functional convergence testing

This commit updates tests/test.yml to deploy rabbitmq, galera,
keystone, and cinder for a functional convergence test.  Note that we
point at a non-existent memcached server, but this can be adjusted to
build memcached if deemed necessary. Additionally, we do not configure
a cinder-volume backend, but simply deploy the service itself. This is
something that can be tweaked in a later revision.

Change-Id: I2d8d2dcc3703603eca96271635311373338cf4da
Partial-Bug: #1553971

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-03-08 18:14:28.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/install-yum.yml', 'tasks/install-apt.yml', 'tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/rsyslog_server_pre_install.yml', 'README.rst', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'vars/debian.yml', 'defaults/main.yml', 'meta/main.yml', 'tasks/rsyslog_server_install.yml'], 'message': 'Multi-distro support for rsyslog-server role

This is an implementation of a pattern for multi-distro support by
including logic to deploy packages via either apt-get or yum.

This change has been tested with CentOS 7 and Ubuntu 14.04.  Package
names and other distro/family specific variables are supplied via one
of the files in vars/ utilizing the following precedence:

"{{ ansible_distribution | lower }}-{{ ansible_distribution_version | lower }}.yml"
"{{ ansible_distribution | lower }}.yml"
"{{ ansible_os_family | lower }}.yml"

In this change, only the files corresponding to 'ansible_os_family'
have been provided.  The included 'families' are 'debian' and 'redhat'

This allows for support of distros other than Ubuntu and CentOS, such
as Debian and Fedora, more easily in the future.

Change-Id: I78c8c3be9d00fc505fabc83de36dfd43b8e85848
'}]
commit_message:
Multi-distro support for rsyslog-server role

This is an implementation of a pattern for multi-distro support by
including logic to deploy packages via either apt-get or yum.

This change has been tested with CentOS 7 and Ubuntu 14.04.  Package
names and other distro/family specific variables are supplied via one
of the files in vars/ utilizing the following precedence:

"{{ ansible_distribution | lower }}-{{ ansible_distribution_version | lower }}.yml"
"{{ ansible_distribution | lower }}.yml"
"{{ ansible_os_family | lower }}.yml"

In this change, only the files corresponding to 'ansible_os_family'
have been provided.  The included 'families' are 'debian' and 'redhat'

This allows for support of distros other than Ubuntu and CentOS, such
as Debian and Fedora, more easily in the future.

Change-Id: I78c8c3be9d00fc505fabc83de36dfd43b8e85848

subject: Build list of enabled os-collect-config collectors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 00:07:04.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/nova/test_server.py', 'heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server.py'], 'message': 'Build list of enabled os-collect-config collectors

When changing the software_config_transport for an existing server,
os-collect-config will continue using the data from the old transport
which will become increasingly stale and will sometimes mask values from
the new transport.

The default list of collectors in os-collect-config is:
heat_local, ec2, cfn, heat, request, local, zaqar

This change explicitly enables these collectors:
ec2, <current transport>, local

``ec2`` is the nova metadata service, so should always be enabled.

``local`` allows local file overrides - this is generally unused but is
enabled for users who choose to use it for additional config data, or to
override the heat provided data.

``heat_local`` is only used on the first run of an unconfigured
os-collect-config for bootstrapping its own config file, so it can and
should be disabled for subsequent polling.

Change-Id: I9cdb057212c7a4404f6966a55cde9eab5ad86759
Closes-Bug: #1523676
(cherry picked from commit 5d1762fec6a7d3f2eaa5f7e4e7ac048e77843cb0)
'}]
commit_message:
Build list of enabled os-collect-config collectors

When changing the software_config_transport for an existing server,
os-collect-config will continue using the data from the old transport
which will become increasingly stale and will sometimes mask values from
the new transport.

The default list of collectors in os-collect-config is:
heat_local, ec2, cfn, heat, request, local, zaqar

This change explicitly enables these collectors:
ec2, <current transport>, local

``ec2`` is the nova metadata service, so should always be enabled.

``local`` allows local file overrides - this is generally unused but is
enabled for users who choose to use it for additional config data, or to
override the heat provided data.

``heat_local`` is only used on the first run of an unconfigured
os-collect-config for bootstrapping its own config file, so it can and
should be disabled for subsequent polling.

Change-Id: I9cdb057212c7a4404f6966a55cde9eab5ad86759
Closes-Bug: #1523676
(cherry picked from commit 5d1762fec6a7d3f2eaa5f7e4e7ac048e77843cb0)

subject: Conditionally set UID/GID for nova user/group
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 20:16:04.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/nova_pre_install.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Conditionally set UID/GID for nova user/group

Deployers with shared storage systems must ensure that the nova
user and group have consistent UID's and GID's respectively. This
patch adds a configurable option for deployers to set a UID/GID
for the nova user and group. Warnings are provided in the
default/main.yml about the potential dangers of adjusting this
value on a production system

Docs and a release note will be proposed separately in the
OpenStack-Ansible main repository for this change.

Closes-Bug: 1544889

Change-Id: I881555a896455ce3c897d56a143a8a25c088880b
"}]
commit_message:
Conditionally set UID/GID for nova user/group

Deployers with shared storage systems must ensure that the nova
user and group have consistent UID's and GID's respectively. This
patch adds a configurable option for deployers to set a UID/GID
for the nova user and group. Warnings are provided in the
default/main.yml about the potential dangers of adjusting this
value on a production system

Docs and a release note will be proposed separately in the
OpenStack-Ansible main repository for this change.

Closes-Bug: 1544889

Change-Id: I881555a896455ce3c897d56a143a8a25c088880b

Fix auth_url for ceilometer configuration

This fix removes the invalid configuration for auth_url which was
configured to use a URI (keystone_service_adminuri) rather than
then a valid Keystone URL.  Additionally the option inside
keystone_authtoken is not necessary according

http://docs.openstack.org/liberty/config-reference/content/section_ceilometer.conf.html

Change-Id: Ibb1b565eda005bcfc99e611afff723ca24176c19
Related-Bug: #1552394

subject: Add validation of log property
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-09 04:20:35.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_log_api/tests/test_service.py', 'monasca_log_api/v2/common/service.py', 'docs/monasca-log-api-spec.md'], 'message': 'Add validation of log property

Log property should have at least following forms
"message", "application_type" and "dimensions".
"application_type" and "dimensions" will be always set.
But "message" will not be always set.
So this validation checks log property has "message".

Change-Id: I9f7cfaf11906724a9cf555b77c61a690f44ddaaa
'}]
commit_message:
Add validation of log property

Log property should have at least following forms
"message", "application_type" and "dimensions".
"application_type" and "dimensions" will be always set.
But "message" will not be always set.
So this validation checks log property has "message".

Change-Id: I9f7cfaf11906724a9cf555b77c61a690f44ddaaa

subject: Clarify virtualenv setup in developer docs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 17:23:37.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/development.environment.rst'], 'message': "Clarify virtualenv setup in developer docs

The Developer Environment documentation has an error where it explains
how to create a virtualenv with tox. If we follow instructions, we end
up with a nasty traceback from tox[1]. This is because the 'venv'
environment in tox.ini is expecting positional arguments and has no
default for when none are provided. This patch cribs from the Ironic
developer docs[2] to add a positional argument to make tox happy.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/489709/
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/dev/dev-quickstart.html

Change-Id: I5478e051372f6133cc902e82c4168774fb15b1df
"}]
commit_message:
Clarify virtualenv setup in developer docs

The Developer Environment documentation has an error where it explains
how to create a virtualenv with tox. If we follow instructions, we end
up with a nasty traceback from tox[1]. This is because the 'venv'
environment in tox.ini is expecting positional arguments and has no
default for when none are provided. This patch cribs from the Ironic
developer docs[2] to add a positional argument to make tox happy.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/489709/
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/dev/dev-quickstart.html

Change-Id: I5478e051372f6133cc902e82c4168774fb15b1df

warn Operators not to use 1.0.0 and then revert this change once
1.1.0 is released.

commit_message:
[Ironic]Match vif-pif mac address before setting 'vif_port_id'

When booting an ironic instance with multi networks, the ironic port
'vif_port_id' may mismatch with the corresponding neutron port.

Closes-Bug: #1549068
Co-Authored-By: Sivaramakrishna Garimella (sivaramakrishna.garimella@hp.com)

Change-Id: Id5f033136283987eef8de4ce2f6be256e48cdbf8

commit_message:
Pecan: use reservations in quota enforcement hook

This change updates the quota enforcement hook to employ reservations
in place of the simple limit check currently used.

As a part of this change, functional tests for the quota enforcement
hook are also added.

Change-Id: I1e8a59ffbb38c252a824337c556249a3e395484d
Related-blueprint: wsgi-pecan-switch

commit_message:
Bay status returns None initially after create

When creating a bay using heat resources, OS::Magnum::Bay, the first
bay status returns None, then the following bay status returns the
correct CREATE_IN_PROGRESS.

Change-Id: I6e3802b1321de5d300e167c5b0f1a9ebf291fe13
Closes-Bug: #1507598

commit_message:
Remove _show_resource() in cinder resources

The method to_dict() has been added into cinder client.
ref: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/207340/16.
Remove _show_resources() in cinder resources and clear TODO annotation.

Change-Id: I1a2130ad72800076eb0f76517f5c2736c884820f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 00:52:25.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/auth_file.pp'], 'message': "auth_file: add tag to File resource

Add a Puppet tag to the File resource that manages '/root/openrc'.
It will allow in puppet-keystone to set some orchestration to make sure
/root/openrc is created *after* managing admin resources.

Change-Id: I203728a25ef8a33787760672b17e61539ad820c3
"}]
commit_message:
auth_file: add tag to File resource

Add a Puppet tag to the File resource that manages '/root/openrc'.
It will allow in puppet-keystone to set some orchestration to make sure
/root/openrc is created *after* managing admin resources.

Change-Id: I203728a25ef8a33787760672b17e61539ad820c3

subject: Moved handling of polling threads to PollingDataSourceDriver
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 10:02:10.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/datasources/test_datasource_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py'], 'message': "Moved handling of polling threads to PollingDataSourceDriver

After adding PushedDataSourceDriver, handling of polling threads was
left in the common base class (DataSourceDriver). Polling is not used
by PushedDataSourceDriver and it was causing problems when deleting
datasources (i.e. trying to kill thread which didn't exist).

With this change, polling thread handling code is moved down to
PollingDataSourceDriver class and logic is extended to check if the
thread has actually been created. Only then thread termination will
be attempted.

Change-Id: Ifa450fa6bd1c5e15937bbdc76acd9fad64f4d18e
Closes-Bug: #1553982
"}]
commit_message:
Moved handling of polling threads to PollingDataSourceDriver

After adding PushedDataSourceDriver, handling of polling threads was
left in the common base class (DataSourceDriver). Polling is not used
by PushedDataSourceDriver and it was causing problems when deleting
datasources (i.e. trying to kill thread which didn't exist).

With this change, polling thread handling code is moved down to
PollingDataSourceDriver class and logic is extended to check if the
thread has actually been created. Only then thread termination will
be attempted.

Change-Id: Ifa450fa6bd1c5e15937bbdc76acd9fad64f4d18e
Closes-Bug: #1553982

Previously dns_name would be set to empty string as long as the
dns-integration extension was enabled and the user didn't specify a
different value. This meant that dns_name would be cleared even if the
user didn't pass it as a parameter at all. This patch only clears

commit_message:
Only clear dns_name when user specifies parameter

Previously dns_name would be set to empty string as long as the
dns-integration extension was enabled and the user didn't specify a
different value. This meant that dns_name would be cleared even if the
user didn't pass it as a parameter at all. This patch only clears
dns_name if the user passed that parameter without specifying a value.

Change-Id: I1be9a2f9c3dc9850cc167b204506e36d5272d642
Closes-Bug: 1554153

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 15:40:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/extensions/dns_integration.py'], 'message': 'Ensures DNS_DRIVER is loaded before it is checked

Previously it was possible for DNS_DRIVER to be checked here before anything
had attempted to load it, causing the check to erroneuously fail. This patch
makes sure that the check will not fail simply because nothing had loaded it
prior by attempting to load it immediately before the check.

Change-Id: I34537beaf675db2634493dfef27b69051a8d0781
Closes-Bug: 1554151
'}]
commit_message:
Ensures DNS_DRIVER is loaded before it is checked

Previously it was possible for DNS_DRIVER to be checked here before anything
had attempted to load it, causing the check to erroneuously fail. This patch
makes sure that the check will not fail simply because nothing had loaded it
prior by attempting to load it immediately before the check.

Change-Id: I34537beaf675db2634493dfef27b69051a8d0781
Closes-Bug: 1554151

Do not silently drop markers that fail to evaluate

We are silently dropping requirements that do not parse, do not do this
and bubble the error up.

Closes-Bug: 1554331

commit_message:
VMware: remove deprecation warnings from oslo_versionedobjects

The patch address the following warnings:

FutureWarning: fake_uuid is an invalid UUID. Using UUIDFields with
invalid UUIDs is no longer supported, and will be removed in a
future release. Please update your code to input valid UUIDs or
accept ValueErrors for invalid UUIDs.
See http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField
for further details

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I8a96893b6ed6e247c8214a760d5bc8571f89a173

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 05:33:40.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_integration.py', 'pbr/util.py'], 'message': "Ensure we succeed at env_markers or bail gracefully

The current implementation ensuring env_markers are processed may fail
silently or with a stack trace on LTS distributions, this does some
checks attempt to avoid this, and bails with a helpful message if it
needs to.  The 0.6* series would bail with an AttributeError, and 0.7.2
to 17.1 can bail with a 'SyntaxError' if >, >=, <, <= are used.  We need
to ignore SyntaxError so we don't bail on input we are not accounting
for.

Change-Id: Ic3237f30d88337ad838ec81546f5ee4ad54cabce
Closes-Bug: 1502692
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure we succeed at env_markers or bail gracefully

The current implementation ensuring env_markers are processed may fail
silently or with a stack trace on LTS distributions, this does some
checks attempt to avoid this, and bails with a helpful message if it
needs to.  The 0.6* series would bail with an AttributeError, and 0.7.2
to 17.1 can bail with a 'SyntaxError' if >, >=, <, <= are used.  We need
to ignore SyntaxError so we don't bail on input we are not accounting
for.

Change-Id: Ic3237f30d88337ad838ec81546f5ee4ad54cabce
Closes-Bug: 1502692

commit_message:
Backport oslo.log syslog working patch

stable/liberty CentOS is based on oslo.log 0.10.0 which is defective
for our use case.  Instead we have to backport a bug fix.  I tried
using 0.12.1 but this triggers Keystone to enter a 500 state.  The
backported patch is based upon:

This is not a cherry-pick backport because master uses oslo.log 0.12.1
which works just fine.

Change-Id: I90e85143651d6e32b731c3a004cda917b660d5c1
Closes-Bug: #1516306

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-22 14:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/static/dashboard/developer/theme-preview/theme-preview.html'], 'message': 'Fixed a few missed translation strings on Theme preview page

Under the Developer Dashboard, the Bootstrap Theme Preview has a few
strings that are not being translated when they could and should be.
Many of the strings are missing the "translate" directive to enable the
translation, while others include the directive but are not being translated
because of other issues.  The translation directive seems not to work when
there is another HTML element tag nested inside the outer element containing
the translation.  As such is the case with the Dropdown elements.  The
solution to this is to use the translate filter in situations where the
directive will not work.

This change fixes most of the translation issues on this page.

Note: The pseudo translation tool was used to determine what strings are
correctly being translated or not.

Change-Id: I5aeb9f6212f5ba6a1f4cde0b72cce638937b7138
Closes-Bug: #1536785
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed a few missed translation strings on Theme preview page

Under the Developer Dashboard, the Bootstrap Theme Preview has a few
strings that are not being translated when they could and should be.
Many of the strings are missing the "translate" directive to enable the
translation, while others include the directive but are not being translated
because of other issues.  The translation directive seems not to work when
there is another HTML element tag nested inside the outer element containing
the translation.  As such is the case with the Dropdown elements.  The
solution to this is to use the translate filter in situations where the
directive will not work.

This change fixes most of the translation issues on this page.

Note: The pseudo translation tool was used to determine what strings are
correctly being translated or not.

Change-Id: I5aeb9f6212f5ba6a1f4cde0b72cce638937b7138
Closes-Bug: #1536785

commit_message:
Make Functions unhashable

Remove the incorrect __hash__ function added to the Function class in
46233d2c2a7938d6e97f0285f0afad6c2e1baf00 and make the class unhashable. Fix
the one place we were trying to hash it, which is when it appeared in the
deletion_policy of a resource.

Change-Id: I3d47c99470a2404183bccb80269a18623aa79041

commit_message:
Adjust log levels for InstanceShutOffException

Logged messages for compute pollsters are brought in line with the
guidance in openstack-specs as noted in the bug report.

NoDataExceptions still produce a warning as that may be due to cloud
configuration and may be actionable for operators.

Unit tests for compute memory pollsters are adjusted to accommodate
when warnings are not logged.

Change-Id: I84824e409f0643f50f196ba89187f864781a3154
Closes-Bug: #1554318

commit_message:
Implement readline/readlines in IterLike

Now, IterLike has very limited implementation about readline and
readlines. They are not used, but it is not safe.
This patch implements these two functions.

Change-Id: Ic02757cd17da0527713677bcb96682718d5faa7b

subject: libvirt: set libvirt.sysinfo_serial='none' for virt driver tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20683, 'name': 'Venkata Mahesh Chinta', 'email': 'venkata.mahesh.chinta@ericsson.com', 'username': 'MaheshChinta'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-01 19:01:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_virt_drivers.py'], 'message': "libvirt: set libvirt.sysinfo_serial='none' for virt driver tests

The default value for the sysinfo_serial option is 'auto' which
tries to read from the /etc/machine-id file if it exists and is
not empty.

Unit tests should not be dependent on trying to read from system
files outside the virtual environment, so for the generic virt
driver tests set the config option value to 'none' so we don't
do anything for the sysinfo_serial option.

Change-Id: Ib9ba0ec2c1690d93eadb63e699740e4ba988cce1
Closes-Bug: #1551900
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: set libvirt.sysinfo_serial='none' for virt driver tests

The default value for the sysinfo_serial option is 'auto' which
tries to read from the /etc/machine-id file if it exists and is
not empty.

Unit tests should not be dependent on trying to read from system
files outside the virtual environment, so for the generic virt
driver tests set the config option value to 'none' so we don't
do anything for the sysinfo_serial option.

Change-Id: Ib9ba0ec2c1690d93eadb63e699740e4ba988cce1
Closes-Bug: #1551900

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-02 20:56:48.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': "set -o pipefail in deploy.sh

If we don't do this, then commands that we pipe such as the image
build and undercloud install don't fail the run when they fail.
This causes unnecessary confusion and is a problem for testing
undercloud idempotency since a failure reinstalling the undercloud
may not cause a subsequent failure.

Change-Id: Ic4a39c60d3affc2e6234ffc0521c30288f1f95d5
"}]
commit_message:
set -o pipefail in deploy.sh

If we don't do this, then commands that we pipe such as the image
build and undercloud install don't fail the run when they fail.
This causes unnecessary confusion and is a problem for testing
undercloud idempotency since a failure reinstalling the undercloud
may not cause a subsequent failure.

Change-Id: Ic4a39c60d3affc2e6234ffc0521c30288f1f95d5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 06:37:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/filters/test_compute_capabilities_filters.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/compute_capabilities_filter.py'], 'message': "ComputeCapabilitiesFilter failed with non-format 'extra_specs'

Currently, ComputeCapabilitiesFilter returns false if 'extra_specs'
can't retrieve in the host state. And, AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter
also use extra_specs to create new instance in a host aggregate. The
problem is they failed to select any destinations, when the key is in
non-scope format.

We'd better check the capabilities only when the key for the filter is
scope format in capabilities scope (i.e. capabilities:xxx:yyy), rather
than non-scope format (i.e. no : contained).

Change-Id: Icb18dc0beb75561180dfa960e22c7504d703b8af
closes-bug: #1554339
"}]
commit_message:
ComputeCapabilitiesFilter failed with non-format 'extra_specs'

Currently, ComputeCapabilitiesFilter returns false if 'extra_specs'
can't retrieve in the host state. And, AggregateInstanceExtraSpecsFilter
also use extra_specs to create new instance in a host aggregate. The
problem is they failed to select any destinations, when the key is in
non-scope format.

We'd better check the capabilities only when the key for the filter is
scope format in capabilities scope (i.e. capabilities:xxx:yyy), rather
than non-scope format (i.e. no : contained).

Change-Id: Icb18dc0beb75561180dfa960e22c7504d703b8af
closes-bug: #1554339

commit_message:
admin role: make sure openrc is created after

If /root/openrc file management is in the catalog, it makes sure it's
created after creating admin resources, so Puppet catalog does not fail
with authentification errors.

commit_message:
Remove POSIX users, groups, and file modes.

This patch removes File resources which should be delivered by packaging
tools.  These resources (files, directories, modes, users, and group
attributes) could be in conflict with different OS packaging systems
which isn't a desired result.

Co-Authored-By: Ivan Berezovskiy <iberezovskiy@mirantis.com>

Closes-Bug: #1458915

Change-Id: I02fe8cc99dcd56e16ac66136a0da244a1eeb630b

commit_message:
Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator

The default values needed for searchlight's implementation of cors
middleware have been moved from paste.ini into the configuration
hooks provided by oslo.config. Furthermore, these values have been
added to the default initialization procedure. This ensures
that if a value remains unset in the configuration file, it will
fallback to using sane defaults. It also ensures that an operator
modifying the configuration will be presented with that same
set of defaults.

Change-Id: Iada9cedcdc5b104bf2fa1c68d0d74794c04d1d28
Closes-Bug: 1551836

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-01 01:51:22.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/rsrc_defn.py'], 'message': "Eliminate bogus deprecation warning

There's nothing about hashing a ResourceDefinition that is deprecated or is
ever going away - in fact, the actual implementation of __hash__() is in
ResourceDefinitionCore, and it's only explicitly included in
ResourceDefinition because there is also an __eq__() method which would
otherwise cause Python 3 to override __hash__ with None (per
46233d2c2a7938d6e97f0285f0afad6c2e1baf00). Therefore it's
completely wrong to log a warning, since everything will continue to work
fine when ResourceDefinition is replaced by ResourceDefinitionCore.

Change-Id: I33fc8727c9ec92580a2e2e7f4475d0f4fff2234b
Closes-Bug: #1546362
(cherry picked from commit d60d47b23f81fa521d695df89e92afac41885690)
"}]
commit_message:
Eliminate bogus deprecation warning

There's nothing about hashing a ResourceDefinition that is deprecated or is
ever going away - in fact, the actual implementation of __hash__() is in
ResourceDefinitionCore, and it's only explicitly included in
ResourceDefinition because there is also an __eq__() method which would
otherwise cause Python 3 to override __hash__ with None (per
46233d2c2a7938d6e97f0285f0afad6c2e1baf00). Therefore it's
completely wrong to log a warning, since everything will continue to work
fine when ResourceDefinition is replaced by ResourceDefinitionCore.

Change-Id: I33fc8727c9ec92580a2e2e7f4475d0f4fff2234b
Closes-Bug: #1546362
(cherry picked from commit d60d47b23f81fa521d695df89e92afac41885690)

subject: Object POST update gets distinct async pending file
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 17:45:07.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/server.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py'], 'message': "Object POST update gets distinct async pending file

Each object update to a container server is saved in a
pending file if the initial update attempt fails. Pending
file names were derived from the update request's x-timestamp,
which is equal to the object's data file timestamp. This meant
that updates due to an object POST used the same async pending
file as updates due to the object's PUT.

This is not so bad because the object POST update has a superset
of the metadata included in the PUT update. But there is a risk
of a race condition causing an update to be lost: the updater may
open an update file due to a PUT whuile the object server is
writing an update due to a POST to the same file name. The
updater could then unlink the file before the more recent update
for the POST is sent.

This patch changes the POST update pending file name to be derived
from the object's metadata timestamp, thus making it distinct from
the PUT update pending file name. There is no upgrade impact since
existing pending files will continue to be processed.

Change-Id: I1b093c837efe8c2a64e92075ebd5e1b93e30efb9
"}]
commit_message:
Object POST update gets distinct async pending file

Each object update to a container server is saved in a
pending file if the initial update attempt fails. Pending
file names were derived from the update request's x-timestamp,
which is equal to the object's data file timestamp. This meant
that updates due to an object POST used the same async pending
file as updates due to the object's PUT.

This is not so bad because the object POST update has a superset
of the metadata included in the PUT update. But there is a risk
of a race condition causing an update to be lost: the updater may
open an update file due to a PUT whuile the object server is
writing an update due to a POST to the same file name. The
updater could then unlink the file before the more recent update
for the POST is sent.

This patch changes the POST update pending file name to be derived
from the object's metadata timestamp, thus making it distinct from
the PUT update pending file name. There is no upgrade impact since
existing pending files will continue to be processed.

Change-Id: I1b093c837efe8c2a64e92075ebd5e1b93e30efb9

commit_message:
Store config in drivers and use it to get list_limit

With domain-specific configs, different drivers will be used for
different domains. Options might be different for these drivers. For
example, user might want to user different list_limit for a domain.

Partial-Bug: 1495669
Change-Id: I706843d7860ec5718c9fbf62af7a65b89b67e4b3

This patch removes the custom plugin.__init__ patching the functional
tests currently exercise in favor of mocking the 'get_api' function that
returns an elasticsearch connection. The plugin instantiation code now runs
the actual plugin __init__ code, and searchlight.elasticsearch.get_api
behaves as might be expected.

commit_message:
Remove custom plugin.__init__in func tests

This patch removes the custom plugin.__init__ patching the functional
tests currently exercise in favor of mocking the 'get_api' function that
returns an elasticsearch connection. The plugin instantiation code now runs
the actual plugin __init__ code, and searchlight.elasticsearch.get_api
behaves as might be expected.

Change-Id: If92b52fbba03af3ddd3d8726ecf2852836c26099
Closes-Bug: #1554698

commit_message:
Fix loose filters

This commit fixes the "Search for ..." filter of the several pages. We
should care about only names or its keys and the other variables such as
Passes/Failures count, ratio, etc are useless.

Closes-Bug: #1549322
Change-Id: I0493be4144b39d3249348be9b6f3f0ebe99e29a2

subject: Fix _parent determination in some role sep configs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 19:40:45.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/unit/test_indexing_helper.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/utils.py', 'searchlight/tests/fake_plugins.py'], 'message': 'Fix _parent determination in some role sep configs

This patch attempts to make handling of the _parent field in some
parent/child role separation scenarios. The bulk action code generation
needs to be refactored but outside the scope of this patch which is to
fix some real behavioral problems, primarily where the parent or child
plugins (but not both) are under role separation. The action generation
code is not very consistent which makes this harder to grasp. This patch
adds several unit tests to test these conditions.

The situations that can occur, and how _parent is dealt with, are:

* parent is role separated
  * child is role separated: the _USER and _ADMIN docs each refer to a
        parent with the same suffix
  * child is NOT separated: this case is not encouraged, but where it
        exists the child documents will use the _USER parent document as
        their _parent to avoid security issues with has_parent query
        fishing
* parent is not role separated
  * child is role separated: both child docs will use the parent id
        without any prefix
  * child is not role separated: the simple case; no suffix in either
        case

Change-Id: I95df802079d530d5532e598ea66a684067c0e9e4
Closes-Bug: #1550440
'}]
commit_message:
Fix _parent determination in some role sep configs

This patch attempts to make handling of the _parent field in some
parent/child role separation scenarios. The bulk action code generation
needs to be refactored but outside the scope of this patch which is to
fix some real behavioral problems, primarily where the parent or child
plugins (but not both) are under role separation. The action generation
code is not very consistent which makes this harder to grasp. This patch
adds several unit tests to test these conditions.

The situations that can occur, and how _parent is dealt with, are:

* parent is role separated
  * child is role separated: the _USER and _ADMIN docs each refer to a
        parent with the same suffix
  * child is NOT separated: this case is not encouraged, but where it
        exists the child documents will use the _USER parent document as
        their _parent to avoid security issues with has_parent query
        fishing
* parent is not role separated
  * child is role separated: both child docs will use the parent id
        without any prefix
  * child is not role separated: the simple case; no suffix in either
        case

Change-Id: I95df802079d530d5532e598ea66a684067c0e9e4
Closes-Bug: #1550440

commit_message:
Only unset proxy for deploy command

If we completely unset http_proxy before deploying, then we also
lose the proxy for the ping test, which is bad because we download
a 150 MB Fedora image in that step.

Change-Id: I7cd4b336e97b82cb356d73bbebf51bd8f36a06ae

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 04:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['shade/inventory.py'], 'message': 'Catch failures with particular clouds

If one cloud is unavailable list_hosts will fail and return no results
even if another cloud had a listing. Add a flag to allow users to
pull results from whichever clouds they can.

This is to allow infra to continue working across whichever clouds
are up should one fail.

Change-Id: Ic2bb2a1642dedead73d7c2e4e60ec59ae8299ef0
'}]
commit_message:
Catch failures with particular clouds

If one cloud is unavailable list_hosts will fail and return no results
even if another cloud had a listing. Add a flag to allow users to
pull results from whichever clouds they can.

This is to allow infra to continue working across whichever clouds
are up should one fail.

Change-Id: Ic2bb2a1642dedead73d7c2e4e60ec59ae8299ef0

subject: Only reduce the node vm's when using introspection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 15:27:56.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': "Only reduce the node vm's when using introspection

We have been removing vm's from instackenv.json to make introspection
run faster since it will only introspect the same number of nodes we
intend to use in the job.

However, this means that we are more likely to hit a scheduling bug in
Nova: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1341420

To mitigate the issue somewhat, only remove nodes from instackenv.json
when using introspection instead of for all jobs.

Change-Id: I397eda9c9ae8d63b0d49f42b59b650fa595cc72a
"}]
commit_message:
Only reduce the node vm's when using introspection

We have been removing vm's from instackenv.json to make introspection
run faster since it will only introspect the same number of nodes we
intend to use in the job.

However, this means that we are more likely to hit a scheduling bug in
Nova: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1341420

To mitigate the issue somewhat, only remove nodes from instackenv.json
when using introspection instead of for all jobs.

Partial-Bug: #1341420
Change-Id: I397eda9c9ae8d63b0d49f42b59b650fa595cc72a

subject: Always ensure that the local lxc cache file matches the upstream image
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-07 16:01:15.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/lxc_cache.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Always ensure that the local lxc cache file matches the upstream image

Ansible 1.9x only actually checks whether there's a local file - it never
checks whether the local file matches the given sha256sum.

We therefore need to set 'force:yes' to ensure that Ansible does the
following:
 - download the file to a temporary location, checking its sha256sum
   against the given value
 - check the sha256sum of the existing file and the downloaded file
 - if the sha256sums match, then throw away the temp file
 - if the sha256sums do not match, replace the existing file

In order to also provide the ability to forcibly delete any existing lxc
cache which was previously prepared (successfully or unsuccessfully), the
boolean variable 'lxc_container_base_delete' has been added.

Change-Id: I988940892c89679edea887716851314fc1cf13b5
Closes-Bug: #1539236
"}]
commit_message:
Always ensure that the local lxc cache file matches the upstream image

Ansible 1.9x only actually checks whether there's a local file - it never
checks whether the local file matches the given sha256sum.

We therefore need to set 'force:yes' to ensure that Ansible does the
following:
 - download the file to a temporary location, checking its sha256sum
   against the given value
 - check the sha256sum of the existing file and the downloaded file
 - if the sha256sums match, then throw away the temp file
 - if the sha256sums do not match, replace the existing file

In order to also provide the ability to forcibly delete any existing lxc
cache which was previously prepared (successfully or unsuccessfully), the
boolean variable 'lxc_container_base_delete' has been added.

Change-Id: I988940892c89679edea887716851314fc1cf13b5
Closes-Bug: #1539236

commit_message:
Use swap-partition.yaml environment

Instead of using the environment file to create a swap file, use the one
that enables swap on a precreated partition. To create the partition, we
recreate the baremetal flavor so that Ironic allocates 1GB for swap in a
seperate partition.

Change-Id: Ie64a80fe72c7e2f1e6bfb3c3c3da0f6bc561e453
Depends-On: I5cd68c13dbfe53eecf6c6ad93151eadc980a902d

subject: Add internal method to increase ring partition power
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16896, 'name': 'Ondřej Nový', 'email': 'novy@ondrej.org', 'username': 'onovy'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-04 08:02:24.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/ring/builder.py', 'test/unit/common/ring/test_builder.py'], 'message': 'Add internal method to increase ring partition power

This method increases the partition power of an existing ring by one. It does
not move any data nor does it exposes a CLI command yet; it is only intended to
be used in a future version to do the actual ring modification itself.

An existing object that is currently located on partition X will be placed
either on partition 2*X or 2*X+1 after the partition power got increased. The
reason for this is the Ring.get_part() method, that does a bitwise shift to the
right.

To avoid actual data movement to different disks or even nodes, the allocation
of partitions to nodes needs to be changed. The allocation is pairwise due to
the above mentioned new partition scheme. Therefore devices are allocated like
this, with the partition being the index and the value being the device id:

OLD: 0,    3,    7,    5,    2,    1,    ...
NEW: 0, 0, 3, 3, 7, 7, 5, 5, 2, 2, 1, 1, ...

If an operator stops the cluster, increases the partition power and renames &
hardlinks the existing data it is possible to do a power shift without actually
moving data. Please see the partition power spec for further details on this.

Change-Id: I063fd8077497ee8c14d9065f07b4ec0fb5cbe180
Partially-Implements: spec increasing_partition_power
'}]
commit_message:
Add internal method to increase ring partition power

This method increases the partition power of an existing ring by one. It does
not move any data nor does it exposes a CLI command yet; it is only intended to
be used in a future version to do the actual ring modification itself.

An existing object that is currently located on partition X will be placed
either on partition 2*X or 2*X+1 after the partition power got increased. The
reason for this is the Ring.get_part() method, that does a bitwise shift to the
right.

To avoid actual data movement to different disks or even nodes, the allocation
of partitions to nodes needs to be changed. The allocation is pairwise due to
the above mentioned new partition scheme. Therefore devices are allocated like
this, with the partition being the index and the value being the device id:

OLD: 0,    3,    7,    5,    2,    1,    ...
NEW: 0, 0, 3, 3, 7, 7, 5, 5, 2, 2, 1, 1, ...

If an operator stops the cluster, increases the partition power and renames &
hardlinks the existing data it is possible to do a power shift without actually
moving data. Please see the partition power spec for further details on this.

Change-Id: I063fd8077497ee8c14d9065f07b4ec0fb5cbe180
Partially-Implements: spec increasing_partition_power

commit_message:
Adds virtual_size to notifications

The virtual_size property was added to the v2 API in Icehouse as a
"core" image property [0], but the field was not added to image
notifications.  This patch addresses that oversight.

[0] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/glance/+spec/split-image-size

Change-Id: I423719a88ba1ef17e7475ab5388fb1720a28011e
Closes-bug: #1554206

commit_message:
Enable functional convergence testing

This commit updates tests/test.yml to deploy rabbitmq, galera,
keystone, and glance for a functional convergence test.  Note that we
point at a non-existent memcached server, but this can be adjusted to
build memcached if deemed necessary.

Change-Id: I389d23561313882a0c3fb6236159fee71ab54c3f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 14323, 'name': 'HP Networking CI', 'email': 'hpnopenstackci@hp.com', 'username': 'hpn'}, {'_account_id': 14571, 'name': 'Intel Experimental CI', 'email': 'openstack-networking-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 19:32:44.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha.py'], 'message': "Add support for Keepalived VRRP health check

Adds functionality to generate bash script which verify health of current
keepalived instance by pinging all available in configuration GW addresess.
This functionality supports IPv4 and IPv6 by detecting needed ping version
using netaddr.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_vrrp_health_check' which is by default set for False. Designates is
health check functionality should be enabled. Requires allowed ICMP
ECHO_REQUEST because of that by default disabled.
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_vrrp_health_check_interval' which will determine the VRRP health check interval
in seconds.

Change-Id: Ic29b11d2061b732d339abd492a18f2fffb3ff5c1
Closes-Bug: #1365461
Closes-Bug: #1375625
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for Keepalived VRRP health check

Adds functionality to generate bash script which verify health of current
keepalived instance by pinging all available in configuration GW addresess.
This functionality supports IPv4 and IPv6 by detecting needed ping version
using netaddr.

DocImpact:
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_vrrp_health_check' which is by default set for False. Designates is
health check functionality should be enabled. Requires allowed ICMP
ECHO_REQUEST because of that by default disabled.
Added a new parameter to 'l3_agent.ini' named
'ha_vrrp_health_check_interval' which will determine the VRRP health check interval
in seconds.

Change-Id: Ic29b11d2061b732d339abd492a18f2fffb3ff5c1
Closes-Bug: #1365461
Closes-Bug: #1375625

subject: Only create 1024MB swap in tripleo-ci
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-05 17:08:21.000000000', 'files': ['test-environments/swapfile.yaml'], 'message': "Only create 1024MB swap in tripleo-ci

Instead of creating the default 4096MB of swap, only create 1024MB of
swap.

We're seeing slower CI jobs and occurrences of the
*AllNodesValidationDeployment resources, which ping the Controller IP's,
in CI.  One theory is that this is related to the recent addition of
swap to the overcloud nodes. Creating less swap could address the issue.

Depends-On: Ia2a10318de47854a9b8932d72243ce0a85603556
Change-Id: I55fd8ff32351e747e43e2d55152b3aee25874859
Partial-Bug: #1553243
"}]
commit_message:
Only create 1024MB swap in tripleo-ci

Instead of creating the default 4096MB of swap, only create 1024MB of
swap.

We're seeing slower CI jobs and occurrences of the
*AllNodesValidationDeployment resources, which ping the Controller IP's,
in CI.  One theory is that this is related to the recent addition of
swap to the overcloud nodes. Creating less swap could address the issue.

Depends-On: Ia2a10318de47854a9b8932d72243ce0a85603556
Change-Id: I55fd8ff32351e747e43e2d55152b3aee25874859
Partial-Bug: #1553243
