subject: Fix rabbitmq ssl logic
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-07 21:18:42.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp'], 'message': 'Fix rabbitmq ssl logic

Saying ! is_service_default($rabbit_use_ssl) and $rabbit_use_ssl is
invalid logic: it checks that the value is not the ensure=>absent
default and is also boolean true, when it should be checking whether it
is boolean false. This was leading to an error where if the kombu_*
parameters were not set but $rabbitmq_use_ssl was set to true, puppet
would fail. It is valid to set rabbitmq_use_false to true while not
setting the kombu_* parameters, it is just not valid the other way
around. This change fixes the logic, adds checks for definition and
truthiness of the kombu_* params, and fixes the error message. This
makes the logic identical to the rabbitmq SSL handling in the neutron
module[1].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-neutron/tree/manifests/init.pp#n356

Closes-Bug: #1356083
Change-Id: I1f4a67c4b8d43670793331254818b6991b8de640
(cherry picked from commit d850c3e34b59c2305901a7692e1a90c0952ae59c)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq ssl logic

Saying ! is_service_default($rabbit_use_ssl) and $rabbit_use_ssl is
invalid logic: it checks that the value is not the ensure=>absent
default and is also boolean true, when it should be checking whether it
is boolean false. This was leading to an error where if the kombu_*
parameters were not set but $rabbitmq_use_ssl was set to true, puppet
would fail. It is valid to set rabbitmq_use_false to true while not
setting the kombu_* parameters, it is just not valid the other way
around. This change fixes the logic, adds checks for definition and
truthiness of the kombu_* params, and fixes the error message. This
makes the logic identical to the rabbitmq SSL handling in the neutron
module[1].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-neutron/tree/manifests/init.pp#n356

Closes-Bug: #1356083
Change-Id: I1f4a67c4b8d43670793331254818b6991b8de640
(cherry picked from commit d850c3e34b59c2305901a7692e1a90c0952ae59c)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 17:15:32.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/common/validators.py'], 'message': 'Beef up Barbican Validation

This patch disallows properties which have nothing to do with
Barbican Object and sets limits to certiain properties.
Passing additional properties causes confusion to the user.

Example: When passing metadata for secret creation if it
looks like:
{
"name": "all mine"
"junk": "some junk"
}

an error will be thrown as follows:
HTTPBadRequest: Provided object does not match schema 'Secret':
Additional properties are not allowed (u'name' was unexpected).

Change-Id: Id80e605fb59c5300e2a78518486f04c238d3dfd3
'}]
commit_message:
Beef up Barbican Validation

This patch disallows properties which have nothing to do with
Barbican Object and sets limits to certiain properties.
Passing additional properties causes confusion to the user.

Example: When passing metadata for secret creation if it
looks like:
{
"name": "all mine"
"junk": "some junk"
}

an error will be thrown as follows:
HTTPBadRequest: Provided object does not match schema 'Secret':
Additional properties are not allowed (u'name' was unexpected).

Change-Id: Id80e605fb59c5300e2a78518486f04c238d3dfd3

commit_message:
Remove external network hooks and auto-added resources

Previously the orchestrator could be configured to create access to the
external network.  This combined with auto external gateway additions
would cause problems with automation tools and did not work reliably.
This change removes this functionality since it was often disabled in
production deployments. This change aslo slightly reduces devstack
runtime by removing the Neutron restart.

Change-Id: I556f1fc2729f1d62a60de24b6d5e9ed473749f9a

Add vexxhost and osic Ubuntu mirror configs to gate check

Two new providers have been added to OpenStack-CI's list of nodepool
providers. This patch ensures that we have an appropriate apt mirror
configured if the gate job runs on one of those providers.

commit_message:
Handles db errors caused by binding deleted ports

It is possible that while a dvr port is being bound,
a DBReferenceError exception is thrown. There are many
reasons why this exception could be thrown, for example,
the port could have been deleted, or some other field
in the query could be incorrect or deleted.
This patch catches that exception and logs it as a
debug messages.
The debug message will contain the exception reason, which
should state why the exception was thrown.

Change-Id: I654ac62df8674122b36ec7429a6db8a1e987b182
Related-Bug: #1501515

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 22:59:12.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/all_nodes/swap-partition.yaml'], 'message': "Add an environment to use a swap partition

This environment can be used with AllNodesExtraConfig to enable swap on
a device with the given label as specified by the swap_partition_label
parameter.

If Ironic is used to create the swap partition, the partition will have
a label of swap1, so that's a reasonable default for the parameter.

The partition is also written to /etc/fstab as a swap mount so that it
will be enabled on reboot.

Change-Id: I5cd68c13dbfe53eecf6c6ad93151eadc980a902d
"}]
commit_message:
Add an environment to use a swap partition

This environment can be used with AllNodesExtraConfig to enable swap on
a device with the given label as specified by the swap_partition_label
parameter.

If Ironic is used to create the swap partition, the partition will have
a label of swap1, so that's a reasonable default for the parameter.

The partition is also written to /etc/fstab as a swap mount so that it
will be enabled on reboot.

Change-Id: I5cd68c13dbfe53eecf6c6ad93151eadc980a902d

commit_message:
Check correct minimum size for data disk

Currently we choose the largest available disk as the data disk, however
this may be too small to be useful. This patch checks disqualifies disks
that are smaller than the minimum.

It also sets the minimum to the proper value of 60GB free on the root
disk or 60GB available on the designated secondary disk. The previous
check was 60GB on root and 80GB on the secondary disk which is not
the intented check as noted in the documentation.

(cherry picked from commit ec14005f7608727896ac21877679d825b557a75a)

Conflicts:
	tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/check-requirements.yml

Change-Id: Id225dc55068e1eed2e19e1e27b0f626163f03db2

subject: Fix bugs when running run-upgrade.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-08 16:25:32.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/upgrade-utilities/playbooks/deploy-config-changes.yml', 'scripts/upgrade-utilities/scripts/add_new_neutron_env.py', 'scripts/run-upgrade.sh', 'scripts/upgrade-utilities/scripts/fix_ceilometer_env.py'], 'message': 'Fix bugs when running run-upgrade.sh

Adjust the path for bootstrap-ansible.sh to use the correct variable
SCRIPTS_PATH.

Define the missing Ansible var root_dir in deploy-config-changes.yml and
rename it to repo_root_dir.

Modify add_new_neutron_env.py so that it updates the file
/etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/neutron.yml instead of the version being
carried in the repo. Pass into the script the path to the root of the
repo, this fixes the incorrect path calculated by the script.

Make fix_ceilometer_env.py executable so that it can be used by
run-upgrade.sh.

Change-Id: Ied10466c31c1e78d60efc17498daff0d24c2a380
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bugs when running run-upgrade.sh

Adjust the path for bootstrap-ansible.sh to use the correct variable
SCRIPTS_PATH.

Define the missing Ansible var root_dir in deploy-config-changes.yml and
rename it to repo_root_dir.

Modify add_new_neutron_env.py so that it updates the file
/etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/neutron.yml instead of the version being
carried in the repo. Pass into the script the path to the root of the
repo, this fixes the incorrect path calculated by the script.

Make fix_ceilometer_env.py executable so that it can be used by
run-upgrade.sh.

Change-Id: Ied10466c31c1e78d60efc17498daff0d24c2a380

commit_message:
Add vexxhost and osic Ubuntu mirror configs to gate check

Two new providers have been added to OpenStack-CI's list of nodepool
providers. This patch ensures that we have an appropriate apt mirror
configured if the gate job runs on one of those providers.

commit_message:
Add missing PROJECT definition

The job was missing the $project definition which is causing it to fail
to find the pre and post gate scripts.

commit_message:
Fix sorting on LC_ALL=C platforms

We made assumptions on the platform for sorting purposes, which turned
out to break with new images being deployed. Explicitly setting LC_ALL
should make this work.

Change-Id: Id65f1bff8e38c777fa406d88ac6a2355d6033d94

commit_message:
Revert "Turn selinux back on after cloud-init"

This reverts commit cf85c5ac03637a4e290ccc1eab404efb49e59a88.

The kube-scheduler failed to spin up after that commit. As a result,
the k8s bay is not functioning. I would suggest to revert that
commit first if we cannot figure out a quick fix.

Closes-Bug: #1551648
Change-Id: If7f8164368be3eec39f9a795a5e7748af68a6f48

finish_migration() in the libvirt driver was attempting to resize an

re-orders these 2 operations. In doing so, we also have to resolve an

Change-Id: I03e08fae97416ebe5cdedcf238a06d1b90203c5d

commit_message:
libvirt: Fix resize of instance with deleted glance image

finish_migration() in the libvirt driver was attempting to resize an
image before checking that its backing file was present. This patch
re-orders these 2 operations. In doing so, we also have to resolve an
overloading of the 'disk_info' variable.

Closes-Bug: #1546778

Change-Id: I03e08fae97416ebe5cdedcf238a06d1b90203c5d

subject: go: replication prioritizer
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-01 21:33:27.000000000', 'files': ['go/objectserver/replicator_test.go', 'go/objectserver/replicator.go', 'go/cmd/hummingbird.go', 'go/objectserver/priorityrep_test.go', 'go/hummingbird/server.go', 'go/objectserver/priorityrep.go', 'go/objectserver/repconn.go'], 'message': "go: replication prioritizer

This adds two new commands:

  hummingbird moveparts [old ring.gz] [new ring.gz]

After a rebalance, moveparts will diff the two rings and instruct the
object replicators (via HTTP call) to execute jobs that bulk move
any re-assigned partitions.

  hummingbird restoredevice [ip] [device-name]

restoredevice will instruct peers of the selected device to sync over
their copies of any partitions that should be on that drive.  It can
be used to speed up restoring a drive after it's been swapped.

They should both run until all of the jobs have been taken up by the
replicator, so a large job might take a while.

This means the replicator has a semi-real HTTP server now, and not
just a debug port.  It binds to the replication object server's port
+ 500, which is totally arbitrary and open to bikeshedding.

Change-Id: I4bbb2719657eb84c5191e053a1654e986511bb95
"}]
commit_message:
go: replication prioritizer

This adds two new commands:

  hummingbird moveparts [old ring.gz] [new ring.gz]

After a rebalance, moveparts will diff the two rings and instruct the
object replicators (via HTTP call) to execute jobs that bulk move
any re-assigned partitions.

  hummingbird restoredevice [ip] [device-name]

restoredevice will instruct peers of the selected device to sync over
their copies of any partitions that should be on that drive.  It can
be used to speed up restoring a drive after it's been swapped.

They should both run until all of the jobs have been taken up by the
replicator, so a large job might take a while.

This means the replicator has a semi-real HTTP server now, and not
just a debug port.  It binds to the replication object server's port
+ 500, which is totally arbitrary and open to bikeshedding.

Change-Id: I4bbb2719657eb84c5191e053a1654e986511bb95

commit_message:
always build release notes from master

Ensure that the release notes job that runs after a patch merges or when
a tag is applied always checks out the master branch of the project so
the full set of notes is built, and not just the version from the branch
into which the patch merged.

Change-Id: I7cbb0f60d8120300c438cb44598b9f7b16e8abe5
Closes-Bug: #1552911
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
[Verify] Improve comparison of Neutron client versions

The current mechanism that compares Neutron client versions in the
_configure_network_feature_enabled method will not work when we have
Neutron client version, for example, 5.1.2. So this patch is intended
to fix the issue.

Change-Id: I6bb7c96456207e291ad6b889de922985f58b240a

This patch moves the default_store config option to the glance::api
class, and makes it possible to configure more than one store while
supplying a value for the default store to be used. If only one store
is given for glance_store/stores, the default store is automatically
set to be the same value. If multiple stores are given and no default
store is explicitly set, the config will fail and ask the user to

Change-Id: I28a79ae36e673a3537ea16910d338666b65c80f7
Closes-bug: #1481460
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@mirantis.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Implement multiple store configuration

This patch moves the default_store config option to the glance::api
class, and makes it possible to configure more than one store while
supplying a value for the default store to be used. If only one store
is given for glance_store/stores, the default store is automatically
set to be the same value. If multiple stores are given and no default
store is explicitly set, the config will fail and ask the user to
provide a default store.

Change-Id: I28a79ae36e673a3537ea16910d338666b65c80f7
Closes-bug: #1481460
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@mirantis.com>

This patch adds a configurable option for deployers to apply security
hardening by adjusting apply_security_hardening to true within
the user_variables.yml file. In addition, security hardening is enabled
on AIO builds by default.

Documentation about the security role and how to enable it are also included

This is a backport of Ic05ab7eacd6a1966814764b8290817fb78732758
from master. It also includes the fix from
I2c78f4e913e99e5fc5d84fba9e28197b73ac8f25 that skips the apt key check.

Change-Id: Ic05ab7eacd6a1966814764b8290817fb78732758
'}]
commit_message:
Add config option + docs for security hardening

This patch adds a configurable option for deployers to apply security
hardening by adjusting apply_security_hardening to true within
the user_variables.yml file. In addition, security hardening is enabled
on AIO builds by default.

Documentation about the security role and how to enable it are also included
in this patch.

This is a backport of Ic05ab7eacd6a1966814764b8290817fb78732758
from master. It also includes the fix from
I2c78f4e913e99e5fc5d84fba9e28197b73ac8f25 that skips the apt key check.

Implements: blueprint security-hardening

Change-Id: Ic05ab7eacd6a1966814764b8290817fb78732758

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2016-03-08 08:04:27.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_routers.py'], 'message': 'Added support to verify extra-routes deletion

Earlier the test was only verifying presence of extra routes
on the router.

Tempest client provides a method to delete the extra routes.
Assertion on this deletion was not present before, hence this
support is added.

Now the testcase will assert,

1. Presence of extra routes on the router after creation.
2. Absence of extra routes on the router after deletion.

Change-Id: I6f2c2ebdce227705f073a43ff04c8bddc4ca5fd4
'}]
commit_message:
Added support to verify extra-routes deletion

Earlier the test was only verifying presence of extra routes
on the router.

Tempest client provides a method to delete the extra routes.
Assertion on this deletion was not present before, hence this
support is added.

Now the testcase will assert,

1. Presence of extra routes on the router after creation.
2. Absence of extra routes on the router after deletion.

Change-Id: I6f2c2ebdce227705f073a43ff04c8bddc4ca5fd4

Currently when we specify get_image_location policy for admin,

This makes the policy not useful for users so the spec
contains description of new behaviou to make the policy useful.

bp change-location-policy-v2

Change-Id: I46562cd3b6eae2e4a35d7bdbbb49783a9e078e37
'}]
commit_message:
Change policy approach to show image locations

Currently when we specify get_image_location policy for admin,
this policy also forbids image-show, image-list requests.
This makes the policy not useful for users so the spec
contains description of new behaviou to make the policy useful.

bp change-location-policy-v2

Change-Id: I46562cd3b6eae2e4a35d7bdbbb49783a9e078e37

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-22 11:20:22.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/approved/pluggable-artifact-db-api.rst'], 'message': 'Pluggable Database API for Artifact Storage

The Glance Artifact API Service stores the information about its
artifacts in the main Glance database but in its own set of
independent tables, unrelated to the ones being used by Glance Images
API Service. This set of tables is designed to be artifact-type
independent, i.e. to be able to store the information about all the
artifacts regardless of their type and the version of that types.

However, in some cases such design may be inefficient. This spec
addresses this by providing more capabilities for artifact type
developers or deployers.

Change-Id: I0fe3d93cf07ea08123571a21a03107e712a77a0c
'}]
commit_message:
Pluggable Database API for Artifact Storage

The Glance Artifact API Service stores the information about its
artifacts in the main Glance database but in its own set of
independent tables, unrelated to the ones being used by Glance Images
API Service. This set of tables is designed to be artifact-type
independent, i.e. to be able to store the information about all the
artifacts regardless of their type and the version of that types.

However, in some cases such design may be inefficient. This spec
addresses this by providing more capabilities for artifact type
developers or deployers.

Change-Id: I0fe3d93cf07ea08123571a21a03107e712a77a0c

subject: Image Metadata Mutation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-25 13:00:29.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/image-metadata-mutation.rst'], 'message': 'Image Metadata Mutation

This proposal outlines a configration option for glance which allows
default properties to be applied to an image when it is created. It
is primarily concerned with tagging images with an architecture so
that images are scheduled on the right machine in a heterogeneous
environment, however can be used to change VM IO buses or enable
qemu agent operation by default

Change-Id: I21804aca6dd5bf1eb60b7e7ce5c0ce40ea349de6
'}]
commit_message:
Image Metadata Mutation

This proposal outlines a configration option for glance which allows
default properties to be applied to an image when it is created. It
is primarily concerned with tagging images with an architecture so
that images are scheduled on the right machine in a heterogeneous
environment, however can be used to change VM IO buses or enable
qemu agent operation by default

Change-Id: I21804aca6dd5bf1eb60b7e7ce5c0ce40ea349de6

subject: Add data security related metadata to image
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-02 22:18:47.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/data-security-metadata.rst'], 'message': 'Add data security related metadata to image

Enterprises need to be compliant with data security laws and regulations that
require sensitive data to be encrypted at all times. Many OpenStack services
have features (e.g. transparent data encryption in Nova) that can be combined
together to form a data security compliance plan. However, the burden of
verifying that such features have been enabled falls on the operator. We
propose a new metadata category related to data security that can be defined
on an image. This can form the basis of a declarative data security
enforcement model in which this image metadata is used by various OpenStack
services to enforce/enable the data security features that they are capable of.

Change-Id: I386de387ce086e169ab5c76448fb422e39ab96ac
'}]
commit_message:
Add data security related metadata to image

Enterprises need to be compliant with data security laws and regulations that
require sensitive data to be encrypted at all times. Many OpenStack services
have features (e.g. transparent data encryption in Nova) that can be combined
together to form a data security compliance plan. However, the burden of
verifying that such features have been enabled falls on the operator. We
propose a new metadata category related to data security that can be defined
on an image. This can form the basis of a declarative data security
enforcement model in which this image metadata is used by various OpenStack
services to enforce/enable the data security features that they are capable of.

Change-Id: I386de387ce086e169ab5c76448fb422e39ab96ac

subject: Add keystone::disable_admin_token_auth class
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-01 19:25:46.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/keystone_disable_admin_token_auth_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/keystone_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/disable_admin_token_auth.pp', 'spec/acceptance/keystone_disable_admin_token_auth_spec.rb', 'README.md'], 'message': 'Add keystone::disable_admin_token_auth class

The keystone documentation highly recommends disabling the admin_token
authentication after the initial bootstrap because it exposes a major
attack vector. This patch adds a new class,
keystone::disable_admin_token_auth, which uses ini_subsetting to remove
the admin_token_auth keyword from the pipeline lists.

After the first puppet run, users who use this class with the default
values will need to provide some other way for puppet to authenticate
to keystone. The keystone providers can all read from /root/openrc or
from OS_* environment variables. The openstack_extras::auth_file class
can be used to create the openrc file.

This class must be declared after the main keystone class because it
uses the restart_keystone exec from the main class. This patch moves
this exec out of the $default_domain conditional so that it is
available to reference from the keystone::pipeline class. This is safe
to do because it is a refreshonly exec, so even though it is
unconditionally declared, it will only be activated if the default
domain resource activates it, or the keystone::disable_admin_token_auth
class activates it, or both. It will only restart keystone once no
matter how many times it is activated.

Change-Id: If8a7e1639189f46e16fc996fd7919eb784d24971
Depends-On: Idc3b938e37b792636ec7c2702bf8429467b78d66
(cherry picked from commit 80ae141beba42e4a5a8855a1d3f348868c868b37)
'}]
commit_message:
Add keystone::disable_admin_token_auth class

The keystone documentation highly recommends disabling the admin_token
authentication after the initial bootstrap because it exposes a major
attack vector. This patch adds a new class,
keystone::disable_admin_token_auth, which uses ini_subsetting to remove
the admin_token_auth keyword from the pipeline lists.

After the first puppet run, users who use this class with the default
values will need to provide some other way for puppet to authenticate
to keystone. The keystone providers can all read from /root/openrc or
from OS_* environment variables. The openstack_extras::auth_file class
can be used to create the openrc file.

This class must be declared after the main keystone class because it
uses the restart_keystone exec from the main class. This patch moves
this exec out of the $default_domain conditional so that it is
available to reference from the keystone::pipeline class. This is safe
to do because it is a refreshonly exec, so even though it is
unconditionally declared, it will only be activated if the default
domain resource activates it, or the keystone::disable_admin_token_auth
class activates it, or both. It will only restart keystone once no
matter how many times it is activated.

Change-Id: If8a7e1639189f46e16fc996fd7919eb784d24971
Depends-On: Idc3b938e37b792636ec7c2702bf8429467b78d66
(cherry picked from commit 80ae141beba42e4a5a8855a1d3f348868c868b37)

subject: Use NVRAM data on VM operations
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 10207, 'name': 'Manas Mandlekar', 'email': 'manas.mandlekar@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'manasmandlekar'}, {'_account_id': 13562, 'name': 'Samuel Matzek', 'email': 'smatzek@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'smatzek'}, {'_account_id': 13883, 'name': 'Adam Reznechek', 'email': 'adreznec@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'adrez'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 14806, 'name': 'Chhavi Agarwal', 'email': 'chhagarw@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'chhagarw'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-05 00:00:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_vm.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/__init__.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/nvram/manager.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/tasks/vm.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/tasks/test_vm.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vm.py'], 'message': "Use NVRAM data on VM operations

This change set adds support for setting NVRAM data on newly
created VMs during cold migration, evacuation, and unshelving.
The NVRAM is fetched from the NVRAM store and used on the
create of the VM.

Also in this change, the NVRAM data is deleted when the VM is
deleted from the host if it's determined that the data will
not be needed in the future.  Cases where the data should not
be deleted include:

 - Deleting a VM off the source host when it has been cold
   migrated to a destination host.
 - Deleting a VM that has been shelved since the NVRAM data will
   be needed when it's unshelved.
 - Deleting a VM off the source host when it has been evacuated
   to another host.

Change-Id: I11a2bb2d187e2754c2610f3b7ef69f090cf42fb9
"}]
commit_message:
Use NVRAM data on VM operations

This change set adds support for setting NVRAM data on newly
created VMs during cold migration, evacuation, and unshelving.
The NVRAM is fetched from the NVRAM store and used on the
create of the VM.

Also in this change, the NVRAM data is deleted when the VM is
deleted from the host if it's determined that the data will
not be needed in the future.  Cases where the data should not
be deleted include:

 - Deleting a VM off the source host when it has been cold
   migrated to a destination host.
 - Deleting a VM that has been shelved since the NVRAM data will
   be needed when it's unshelved.
 - Deleting a VM off the source host when it has been evacuated
   to another host.

Change-Id: I11a2bb2d187e2754c2610f3b7ef69f090cf42fb9

commit_message:
Add more implementation details to 'deprecate-v3-api' spec

Initially the spec contained just the description of the v3 API
removal, without any details on where the code being removed should go
and how the glance artifacts service will be run after it's removed
from the main glance-api.

This patch covers this gap by adding appropriate descriptions into the
'Proposed change' and 'Work Items' blocks.

Change-Id: Iac8f149d81e6877021364fe84dd45d8aa91049a9
Targets-blueprint: deprecate_v3_api

subject: VPNaaS Fix bandit Jinja issue
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 01:37:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py'], 'message': 'VPNaaS Fix bandit Jinja issue

The Bandit security scan identifies that the Jinja session loader
does not set autoescape to True if the global JINJA_ENV not set,
which increases risk of injection via the config template file.

>> Issue: [jinja2_autoescape_false] By default, jinja2 sets autoescape
to False. Consider using autoescape=True to mitigate XSS vulnerabilities.
   Severity: High   Confidence: High
   Location: neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py:111

Fixing by setting true.

Scan can be reproduced by downloading the bandit package and running from
neutron-vpnaas directory:
bandit -r neutron_vpnaas -ll -ii

Change-Id: I136704a769fc29f797104f87ced1fa205b3439c7
'}]
commit_message:
VPNaaS Fix bandit Jinja issue

The Bandit security scan identifies that the Jinja session loader
does not set autoescape to True if the global JINJA_ENV not set,
which increases risk of injection via the config template file.

>> Issue: [jinja2_autoescape_false] By default, jinja2 sets autoescape
to False. Consider using autoescape=True to mitigate XSS vulnerabilities.
   Severity: High   Confidence: High
   Location: neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py:111

Fixing by setting true.

Scan can be reproduced by downloading the bandit package and running from
neutron-vpnaas directory:
bandit -r neutron_vpnaas -ll -ii

Change-Id: I136704a769fc29f797104f87ced1fa205b3439c7

commit_message:
Add vexxhost and osic Ubuntu mirror configs to gate check

providers. This patch ensures that we have an appropriate apt mirror
configured if the gate job runs on one of those providers.

commit_message:
Allow for usage of pre-allocated IPs for the management network

Id3d4f12235501ae77200430a2dc022f378dce336 added support for pre-allocated
IPs on the other overlay networks, but because the patch adding the
managment network (I0813a13f60a4f797be04b34258a2cffa9ea7e84f) was
under review around the same time, we missed adding the from_pool
capability to the ManagementNetwork.

Change-Id: If99f37634d5da7e7fb7cfc31232e926bd5ff074a

subject: Fix Scality SOFS support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-26 15:51:38.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/remotefs/test_remotefs.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py', 'os_brick/remotefs/remotefs.py', 'os_brick/initiator/connector.py'], 'message': 'Fix Scality SOFS support

The "Scaling backup service" patch [1] in Cinder (merged a couple of days
ago) uses os-brick to perform a local attach volume. It revealed that the
support for Scality SOFS in os-brick was broken. (we did have a CI in
Cinder but the os-brick code path was not fully exercised until [1] merged).

This patch addresses this issue. The patch introduces a new class called
`ScalityRemoteFsClient` which inherits from `RemoteFsClient`. We can't
strictly use the `RemoteFsClient` because how to mount Scality FS is
a bit different from other FS.

Note that without this patch, the Scality Cinder driver is broken, more
precisely cinder backup is broken. So I would appreciate if we can merge
that for Mitaka (which needs another minor/micro(?) release of os-brick)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262395/

Change-Id: Icfa09b124d252d1d6b07d9cff8c63c7c0d65cc30
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Scality SOFS support

The "Scaling backup service" patch [1] in Cinder (merged a couple of days
ago) uses os-brick to perform a local attach volume. It revealed that the
support for Scality SOFS in os-brick was broken. (we did have a CI in
Cinder but the os-brick code path was not fully exercised until [1] merged).

This patch addresses this issue. The patch introduces a new class called
`ScalityRemoteFsClient` which inherits from `RemoteFsClient`. We can't
strictly use the `RemoteFsClient` because how to mount Scality FS is
a bit different from other FS.

Note that without this patch, the Scality Cinder driver is broken, more
precisely cinder backup is broken. So I would appreciate if we can merge
that for Mitaka (which needs another minor/micro(?) release of os-brick)

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262395/

Change-Id: Icfa09b124d252d1d6b07d9cff8c63c7c0d65cc30

commit_message:
Time to get rid of any last vestiges of slave_of

The controller (apischema and instance controller) have long
understood that slave_of is going away and has supported
replica_of. Getting rid of the slave_of in the client is now one part
of this final 'cleansing'. Look for a corresponding commit on the
controller side which will clean up the rest of it. That commit is
I87c8a14c06fa5df60ea3ed6b09412dc32fafcec7 and the URL for that review
is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/245845/

Change-Id: I9b905716b704ea9ec9332b48b05c49cccbd04c8b
Partial-Bug: #1461196
Depends-On: I87c8a14c06fa5df60ea3ed6b09412dc32fafcec7

commit_message:
Fix issues with test_package_ordering unit test

The test_package_ordering.sh test is failing intermittently because it
doesn't always ignore case, or use a dictionary sort.

This patch changes the sort to use dictionary sort and ignore case (-df)
which should ensure the test is more consistent, regardless of sort
version, and other inconsistencies.

Additionally the rpms-suse/horizon file order was changed to abide by
this consistency.

Change-Id: I5ba46a7faa837208a98c26b4831673e7c7f43c88
Closes-Bug: #1554488

subject: Add all isolated networks to all nodes.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-08 13:58:08.000000000', 'files': ['environments/network-isolation.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'puppet/ceph-storage.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage.yaml'], 'message': 'Add all isolated networks to all nodes.

This change allows every overcloud node to optionally participate in
any of the isolated networks. The optional networks are not enabled
by default, but allow additional flexibility. Since the new networks
are not enabled by default, the standared deployment is unchanged.
This change was originally requested for OpenDaylight support.

There are several use cases for using non-standard networks.
For instance, one example might be adding the Internal API network
to the Ceph nodes, in order to use that network for administrative
functions. Another example would be adding the Storage Management
network to the compute nodes, in order to use it for backup. Without
this change, any deviation from the standard set of roles that use a
network is a custom change to the Heat templates, which makes
upgrades much more difficult.

Change-Id: Ia386c964aa0ef79e457821d8d96ebb8ac2847231
(cherry picked from commit 41b3682f65d2eb0e60d920492d7eb0b53de3a020)
'}]
commit_message:
Add all isolated networks to all nodes.

This change allows every overcloud node to optionally participate in
any of the isolated networks. The optional networks are not enabled
by default, but allow additional flexibility. Since the new networks
are not enabled by default, the standared deployment is unchanged.
This change was originally requested for OpenDaylight support.

There are several use cases for using non-standard networks.
For instance, one example might be adding the Internal API network
to the Ceph nodes, in order to use that network for administrative
functions. Another example would be adding the Storage Management
network to the compute nodes, in order to use it for backup. Without
this change, any deviation from the standard set of roles that use a
network is a custom change to the Heat templates, which makes
upgrades much more difficult.

Change-Id: Ia386c964aa0ef79e457821d8d96ebb8ac2847231
(cherry picked from commit 41b3682f65d2eb0e60d920492d7eb0b53de3a020)

subject: Honor comments for translators when extracting messages
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-07 14:12:08.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'horizon/test/test_dashboards/dogs/puppies/tables.py', 'horizon/test/tests/tables.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/views.py'], 'message': "Honor comments for translators when extracting messages

To extract commments for translators, '--add-comments' option
must be passed to pybabel. Comments for translators were extracted
when we used Django tools to extract messages, but when we switched
to pybabel it was lost. This commit adds the option to run_tests.sh.

Move the place of existing comments for translators
so that pybabel can find them. Django tool and pybabel
expect a bit different places.
Also add comments to ungettext_lazy in test codes.

Closes-Bug: #1553581
Change-Id: Ia2df36dfebb59bede19d57b2158a907126ca1944
"}]
commit_message:
Honor comments for translators when extracting messages

To extract commments for translators, '--add-comments' option
must be passed to pybabel. Comments for translators were extracted
when we used Django tools to extract messages, but when we switched
to pybabel it was lost. This commit adds the option to run_tests.sh.

Move the place of existing comments for translators
so that pybabel can find them. Django tool and pybabel
expect a bit different places.
Also add comments to ungettext_lazy in test codes.

Closes-Bug: #1553581
Change-Id: Ia2df36dfebb59bede19d57b2158a907126ca1944

commit_message:
Uncouple lbaas object models from neutron core plugin results

Since I6e1ef53d7aae7d04a5485810cc1db0a8eb125953, subnets have
'description' field. We should accommodate for it on lbaas side.

Instead of introducing yet another field for lbaas object, make base
class filter out unknown fields in from_dict() before passing them into
__init__.

Change-Id: Ib00f61cfbc13bf934c31eb476039728830e79e92
Closes-Bug: #1554076

commit_message:
libvirt: add policy check to avoid using qga in realtime context

Adds a policy check to avoid using qemu guest agent in a realtime
context. We shoud to leading to a very minimal hardware support for
guest.

Blueprint: libvirt-real-time
Change-Id: I7a48fb4fd57d45a2ef7cb57f1c7a727938c80e56

commit_message:
libvirt: introduce block_stats to return device stats

This commit add method block_stats to guest and make it to return a
object BlocStats. It also updates driver to make it to take account
about that new change.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-clean-driver
Change-Id: I3d01a24347ce6045692dd8fc1809dd89ff6386a7

populate_retry is only doing arithmetic without to interact with third

'build_request_spec()' not. This change initializes request_spec soon

Change-Id: I4e72b0bcff9edc5536f3c9185b2233be5875e614

commit_message:
conductor: initialize request_spec to handle expected exception

populate_retry is only doing arithmetic without to interact with third
parts and can throw an *expected* exception where
'build_request_spec()' not. This change initializes request_spec soon
as possible since it's used in case where that *expected* exception is
raised.

Change-Id: I4e72b0bcff9edc5536f3c9185b2233be5875e614

commit_message:
Malformed user access sql for postgres guest agent

The postgresql guest agent creates a malformed sql statement
when attempting to retrieve or modify the list of users with
access to the DB.

Change-Id: I87d3a71b4b567707561dd8110b3f80f8095f95bb
Fixes-bug: 1543816

It will run a play where it will spin up five vms, and will
truncate inventory to consider only three. The play will

It will perform a test on dnsmasq leases file, to ensure that

Change-Id: If56488f78524ceba201b50f76df306620744cda5

commit_message:
Add script and playbook to test dhcp

It will run a play where it will spin up five vms, and will
truncate inventory to consider only three. The play will
configure dns using dynamic inventory, and will take an
extra parameter to specify if we want static ips or not.
It will perform a test on dnsmasq leases file, to ensure that
the dhcp behaviour is working as expected, depending on
the settings.

Change-Id: If56488f78524ceba201b50f76df306620744cda5

subject: Added +2 release names for versionutils
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 15:25:51.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_log/versionutils.py', 'oslo_log/tests/unit/test_versionutils.py'], 'message': 'Added +2 release names for versionutils

The default value for remove_in for versionutils.deprecated is 2,
yet the names of the next two releases following Mitaka are not
defined in the _RELEASES dict. This provides the release name
for Mitaka deprecated functionality.

Change-Id: Ia5fd07d152b590d78e45f4765edef1c9aea7e526
'}]
commit_message:
Added +2 release names for versionutils

The default value for remove_in for versionutils.deprecated is 2,
yet the names of the next two releases following Mitaka are not
defined in the _RELEASES dict. This provides the release name
for Mitaka deprecated functionality.

Change-Id: Ia5fd07d152b590d78e45f4765edef1c9aea7e526

subject: Fixes a few LDAP tests to actually run
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 14:06:29.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap.py'], 'message': 'Fixes a few LDAP tests to actually run

It looks like the original intent of overriding these test methods was
to actually make the test run. The direct parent, BaseLDAPIdentity, was
overriding them from its parent in order to show they raise an
exception. The modified test class tests the fix for this behavior and
want to execute the original test, not the overridden one. Unfortunately
the test method was never actually called.

Change-Id: Ib312e75f5a61ef7518177608acce56dfdc05afbf
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes a few LDAP tests to actually run

It looks like the original intent of overriding these test methods was
to actually make the test run. The direct parent, BaseLDAPIdentity, was
overriding them from its parent in order to show they raise an
exception. The modified test class tests the fix for this behavior and
want to execute the original test, not the overridden one. Unfortunately
the test method was never actually called.

Change-Id: Ib312e75f5a61ef7518177608acce56dfdc05afbf

This patch disallows properties which have nothing to do with
Barbican Object and sets limits to certiain properties.
Passing additional properties causes confusion to the user.

Example: When passing metadata for secret creation if it
looks like:
{
"name": "all mine"
"junk": "some junk"
}

an error will be thrown as follows:
HTTPBadRequest: Provided object does not match schema 'Secret':
Additional properties are not allowed (u'name' was unexpected).

Change-Id: I0fd927bcd3da79c5f13c1ac334eb1826b85669cf
'}]
commit_message:
Beef up Barbican Validation

This patch disallows properties which have nothing to do with
Barbican Object and sets limits to certiain properties.
Passing additional properties causes confusion to the user.

Example: When passing metadata for secret creation if it
looks like:
{
"name": "all mine"
"junk": "some junk"
}

an error will be thrown as follows:
HTTPBadRequest: Provided object does not match schema 'Secret':
Additional properties are not allowed (u'name' was unexpected).

Change-Id: I0fd927bcd3da79c5f13c1ac334eb1826b85669cf

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-08 13:58:08.000000000', 'files': ['network/config/bond-with-vlans/controller.yaml'], 'message': 'Change default bond-mode

The default balance-tcp is causing issues with deployments.
Defaulting to active-backup.

After ~ 100 guests (total) connectivity to each guest would become spotty
(simple pings would fail, then become successful.) In /var/log/messages
we saw :
"overcloud-controller-1 kernel: openvswitch: ovs-system: deferred action
limit reached, drop recirc action"

For more details, refer to this link:
http://openvswitch.org/pipermail/discuss/2015-October/019168.html

(cherry picked from commit 215cf39c709419f018be02b208af10f2bd4c772e)
'}]
commit_message:
Change default bond-mode

The default balance-tcp is causing issues with deployments.
Defaulting to active-backup.

After ~ 100 guests (total) connectivity to each guest would become spotty
(simple pings would fail, then become successful.) In /var/log/messages
we saw :
"overcloud-controller-1 kernel: openvswitch: ovs-system: deferred action
limit reached, drop recirc action"

For more details, refer to this link:
http://openvswitch.org/pipermail/discuss/2015-October/019168.html

Change-Id: Ia0f2592a289e13472b98d97057cd516c5048fe59
(cherry picked from commit 215cf39c709419f018be02b208af10f2bd4c772e)

commit_message:
Add the rebinding chance in _bind_port_if_needed

Make function _bind_port_if_needed to bind at least one time when the port's
binding status passed in is already in binding_failed.

This is the second attempt to introduce the patch (the first one was
reverted due to regression that broke Ironic), now with proper
notification sent even when binding attempt failed.

The patch also fixes several cases when we attempted to notify with a
binding context that was not committed into database.

The patch changes _attempt_binding to call _commit_port_binding only
with the binding final state:
1. Successful binding: will just call _commit_port_binding.
2. Unsuccessful binding: will call _commit_port_binding at the final
attempt to bind the port.
This is in order to refrain from reverts, with will really complicate
things even  more.

Co-Authored-By: Yalei Wang <yalei.wang@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Nir Magnezi <nmagnezi@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: John Schwarz <jschwarz@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I437290affd8eb87177d0626bf7935a165859cbdd
Closes-Bug: #1399249
(cherry picked from commit 63fe3a418c685ca90077f1dd4c35fd9ccf586fca)

commit_message:

Hyperv driver had some residual use of network_api_class after it was
deprecated in the core. This makes hyperv use nova.network.is_neutron
for selecting its network drivers.

commit_message:
Change the CinderISCSIHelper to lioadm

Previously we used to always set CinderISCSIHelper to lioadm from
the client. With [1] we aim at cleaning up the client from any
default so this change move the actual default into the templates.

Change-Id: Iabc94ad1cce6f1744429aca9f866a59a698f5680
Related-Bug: 1554564

In some circumstances, the file ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yml can

commit_message:
Remove ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yml in clean.sh

In some circumstances, the file ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yml can
become stale and cause the "openstack" command to fail while running
stack.sh.  Currently, clean.sh tries to clean this up, twice, but
does it wrong each time.  This patch just tries once but hopefully
does it right.

Change-Id: Ic4580127c51187b65fab2c055abb2e4ed50a4551
Closes-Bug: 1529025

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-08 13:58:08.000000000', 'files': ['network/config/single-nic-vlans/controller.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/swift-storage.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/README.md', 'network/config/multiple-nics/swift-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/ceph-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/controller-no-external.yaml', 'network/ports/net_ip_list_map.yaml', 'network/ports/net_ip_subnet_map.yaml', 'puppet/cinder-storage.yaml', 'environments/network-isolation.yaml', 'puppet/controller.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/ceph-storage.yaml', 'net-config-noop.yaml', 'network/ports/net_ip_map.yaml', 'overcloud.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/README.md', 'network/config/multiple-nics/compute.yaml', 'puppet/compute.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/ceph-storage.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/controller-no-external.yaml', 'environments/network-management.yaml', 'network/ports/management.yaml', 'net-config-bond.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/cinder-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/compute.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/cinder-storage.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/compute.yaml', 'network/management.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/swift-storage.yaml', 'network/config/multiple-nics/cinder-storage.yaml', 'puppet/swift-storage.yaml', 'puppet/ceph-storage.yaml', 'network/config/bond-with-vlans/controller.yaml', 'network/networks.yaml', 'net-config-bridge.yaml', 'network/config/single-nic-vlans/README.md', 'network/config/multiple-nics/controller.yaml'], 'message': "Add Management Network For System Administration.

This change adds a system management network to all overcloud
nodes. The purpose of this network is for system administration,
for access to infrastructure services like DNS or NTP, or for
monitoring. This allows the management network to be placed on a
bond for redundancy, or for the system management network to be
an out-of-band network with no routing in or out. The management
network might also be configured as a default route instead of the
provisioning 'ctlplane' network.

This change does not enable the management network by default. An
environment file named network-management.yaml may be included to
enable the network and ports for each role. The included NIC config
templates have been updated with a block that may be uncommented
when the management network is enabled.

This change also contains some minor cleanup to the NIC templates,
particularly the multiple nic templates.

Change-Id: I0813a13f60a4f797be04b34258a2cffa9ea7e84f
(cherry picked from commit 15bb67261a333f140f21208e20a112b99eeb609c)
"}]
commit_message:
Add Management Network For System Administration.

This change adds a system management network to all overcloud
nodes. The purpose of this network is for system administration,
for access to infrastructure services like DNS or NTP, or for
monitoring. This allows the management network to be placed on a
bond for redundancy, or for the system management network to be
an out-of-band network with no routing in or out. The management
network might also be configured as a default route instead of the
provisioning 'ctlplane' network.

This change does not enable the management network by default. An
environment file named network-management.yaml may be included to
enable the network and ports for each role. The included NIC config
templates have been updated with a block that may be uncommented
when the management network is enabled.

This change also contains some minor cleanup to the NIC templates,
particularly the multiple nic templates.

Change-Id: I0813a13f60a4f797be04b34258a2cffa9ea7e84f
(cherry picked from commit 15bb67261a333f140f21208e20a112b99eeb609c)

commit_message:
go: O_TMPFILE

Abstract temporary file creation in the object server.
Support for O_TMPFILE on newer linux kernels.

Also replace all AtomicWriteFile calls with the new abstraction,
so we don't have .tmp-o-file problems anymore.

Change-Id: I5ef42896984032b095d574fac21533f9839152a3

commit_message:
Add debug option for running tests

The debug option allows you to run tests easily
with break points in them. Allowing you to debug
the code easier.
To run call `tox -e debug <test_name>`

commit_message:
Move db migration added during Mitaka to proper directory

DB migrations related to VPNaaS endpoint groups and Multiple local
subnets were added during Mitaka dev cycle. They are accidently
placed in liberty directory. We can safely move these files
as db migrations do not depend on file paths.

Closes-Bug: #1553769
Change-Id: I54dd86bb302bed8564430a32012b849f0315d427

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-09-16 15:04:21.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/support-tosca-format.rst'], 'message': 'Support TOSCA definitions for applications

TOSCA is a standard developed under OASIS foundation. It is aimed
to cover definition of complex enterprise applications which might
consist of different loosely coupled components. Components can be
tied by using requirements and capabilities which are part of
TOSCA standard. As TOSCA covers most of the Applications aspects
(excluding application compilation and build) it should be
straightforward to support TOSCA format in murano. TOSCA is
adopted by enterprises so it will allow the openstack ecosystem to
integrate with enterprise IT applications.

Partially Implements: blueprint support-tosca-format

Change-Id: I79d57e838bd7c8ec054194b87d146f505eec6f75
'}]
commit_message:
Support TOSCA definitions for applications

TOSCA is a standard developed under OASIS foundation. It is aimed
to cover definition of complex enterprise applications which might
consist of different loosely coupled components. Components can be
tied by using requirements and capabilities which are part of
TOSCA standard. As TOSCA covers most of the Applications aspects
(excluding application compilation and build) it should be
straightforward to support TOSCA format in murano. TOSCA is
adopted by enterprises so it will allow the openstack ecosystem to
integrate with enterprise IT applications.

Partially Implements: blueprint support-tosca-format

Change-Id: I79d57e838bd7c8ec054194b87d146f505eec6f75

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-08 13:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/hieradata/common.yaml'], 'message': 'Increase default netdev_max_backlog to 10x

It has been observed that on large clouds the netdev backlog
buffer might overflow. This change increases the default by ten
times.

The /proc/net/softnet_stat file contains a counter in the 2nd
column that is incremented when the netdev backlog queue overflows.
If this value is incrementing over time, then netdev_max_backlog
needs to be increased [1].

[1]. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1283676

Change-Id: Iec12324fd3a24e8b608b1e1849c270cc24cb0e60
'}]
commit_message:
Increase default netdev_max_backlog to 10x

It has been observed that on large clouds the netdev backlog
buffer might overflow. This change increases the default by ten
times.

The /proc/net/softnet_stat file contains a counter in the 2nd
column that is incremented when the netdev backlog queue overflows.
If this value is incrementing over time, then netdev_max_backlog
needs to be increased [1].

[1]. https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1283676

Change-Id: Iec12324fd3a24e8b608b1e1849c270cc24cb0e60

commit_message:

commit_message:
Update manuals to use new ``use_neutron`` option

Starting in Mitaka there is a unified use_neutron option that enables
both the network api and security group api. This is prefered over the
class based options which are now deprecated.

commit_message:
Add a new tool to help find the latest versions

As we will be switching to pinning versions in Kolla this tool will
help remove the 'manual' part of that equation by looking up the
versions we want.

The idea would be to eventually turn this into an autoproposal bot so
we only ever need to approve changes.

More work can be done here like automatically updating the
kolla-build.conf

Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Partially-Implements: blueprint upgrade-kolla

Change-Id: I052159850b2579ca6db79be71672be382be8a3a3

commit_message:
Permits configuration of Cinder enabled_backend via hieradata

It is currently possible to provide arbitrary config settings for
Cinder using the "cinder::config::cinder_config:" hiera key. To add
a backend though particular one has to edit the list of enabled
backends in Cinder too which isn't possible. This change will make
it possible using a user-customizable array of backends to be enabled.

Change-Id: Ic664c1c2b0f7b1b4b6be8b5064a38650694d4857

Currently we do not reset instance progress when live migration
finishes. Operator might end up with VMs that have progress set to,
e.g., 92% and ACTIVE state which means nothing and is confusing.
This patch resets instance progress in post_live_migration and
rollback_live_migration.

Change-Id: Ic5ceb7d376f638b8a8804a9473d2e7e2f484c23f
'}]
commit_message:
Reset instance progress when LM finishes

Currently we do not reset instance progress when live migration
finishes. Operator might end up with VMs that have progress set to,
e.g., 92% and ACTIVE state which means nothing and is confusing.
This patch resets instance progress in post_live_migration and
rollback_live_migration.

Change-Id: Ic5ceb7d376f638b8a8804a9473d2e7e2f484c23f

Change-Id: Ia661b4b56827bc07e86ab796d71db5f7528dc4ef

commit_message:
Only use screen when terminal is tty

Seems that our jenkins CI runs in an environment without a tty.
As a result the screen formatter fails in this environment. This
patch conditional uses screen or text formatter depending on the
TTY.

Change-Id: Ia661b4b56827bc07e86ab796d71db5f7528dc4ef
Closes-Bug: #1551431

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-02 03:25:38.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/network/test_security_groups.py'], 'message': 'Protocol validation to convert numbers to types

Currently the validation of specified protocol numbers does
not take into account registered numbers for protocols TCP,
UDP, ICMP, ICMPv6 et.al. The fix for the Bug 1215181 is to
validate protocol numbers given and convert them to type for
known ones, so that duplication can be avoided. If an unknown
number is specified it retains the older behavior and checks
only if it is within the range.

This tempest change is dependent on
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271301/

Change-Id: Ib6aa468673af304f6a7328531eb290e4c4fecdb7
Closes-Bug: #1215181
'}]
commit_message:
Protocol validation to convert numbers to types

Currently the validation of specified protocol numbers does
not take into account registered numbers for protocols TCP,
UDP, ICMP, ICMPv6 et.al. The fix for the Bug 1215181 is to
validate protocol numbers given and convert them to type for
known ones, so that duplication can be avoided. If an unknown
number is specified it retains the older behavior and checks
only if it is within the range.

This tempest change is dependent on
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/271301/

Change-Id: Ib6aa468673af304f6a7328531eb290e4c4fecdb7
Closes-Bug: #1215181

subject: Heat stack was not always deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-07 23:22:45.000000000', 'files': ['murano/engine/system/heat_stack.py'], 'message': "Heat stack was not always deleted

HeatStack.delete() method didn't check stack timestamps
before deletion. As a result it couldn't correctly detect the
fact that delete already started. So it could get UPDATE_COMPLETE
status from last operation instead and fail because it wasn't expected.

Closes-Bug: #1548567
Change-Id: I66130f826c6f72562a7c36920b0decae63adf5e0
"}]
commit_message:
Heat stack was not always deleted

HeatStack.delete() method didn't check stack timestamps
before deletion. As a result it couldn't correctly detect the
fact that delete already started. So it could get UPDATE_COMPLETE
status from last operation instead and fail because it wasn't expected.

Closes-Bug: #1548567
Change-Id: I66130f826c6f72562a7c36920b0decae63adf5e0

commit_message:
Prepare constraints file for periodic bitrot jobs

Neutron 'general' tox targets rely on the file starting from Liberty
since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/289280/

We should prepare the constraints file for tox consumption.

Though it's needed for Liberty only so far, Kilo branch also has the
constraints file in requirements repo, and hence it's safe to prepare it
in case some projects want to consume it in Kilo too.

Closes-Bug: #1554518
Change-Id: I81e9f271304827a9b6e3c270540b21c9d1c0184f

commit_message:
Fix noop and alarm history ttl for aodh

The alarm history ttl has been removed from ceilometer and should now
be set as part of the aodh configuration. This change removes the
check from the ceilometer tests and implements it for aodh.

Also change I48ec5711a507115d8b7cc167ae881cac4637622f removed the
*_hash variables but Change I30a3832a2277fcf54396cb9b13da6050adf85edd
added in node_hash which is now no longer defined. Since the latter
change landed after the removal of the *_hash vars and we do not gate
on noop we ended up with broken noop tests.

Change-Id: I37a7354dfdc5a9592fa244bc87f8ab4f3f924bdf
Closes-Bug: #1554146
Closes-Bug: #1554168

subject: Allow min_l3_agents_per_router to equal one
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 13:42:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': 'Allow min_l3_agents_per_router to equal one

As an operator, when I am running a setup with two network nodes, the
idea of running L3 HA is that an outage of one of the network nodes
should have minimum customer impact. With the current rules in place,
existing setups will indeed have little to no impact, but customers will
not be able to create new routers during the outage.

With this chance in place, we can set min_l3_agents_per_router=1, so the
customers will be affected even less. New routers will be created with
just one instance, which certainly is not optimal, but at least will
fulfill the customer request. Once the second network node recovers, the
second router instance will be added and thus redundancy restored.

Change-Id: I8a5fc74a96c784d474aefe2d9b27eeb66521ca82
'}]
commit_message:
Allow min_l3_agents_per_router to equal one

As an operator, when I am running a setup with two network nodes, the
idea of running L3 HA is that an outage of one of the network nodes
should have minimum customer impact. With the current rules in place,
existing setups will indeed have little to no impact, but customers will
not be able to create new routers during the outage.

With this chance in place, we can set min_l3_agents_per_router=1, so the
customers will be affected even less. New routers will be created with
just one instance, which certainly is not optimal, but at least will
fulfill the customer request. Once the second network node recovers, the
second router instance will be added and thus redundancy restored.

Change-Id: I8a5fc74a96c784d474aefe2d9b27eeb66521ca82

commit_message:
Make upload with --old-deploy-image only look for the old image

The use of --old-deploy-image should ONLY look for the old images, not the
new agent images as well. Only one of the image types should be sent into
glance. This change makes the upload process just look for the old images
when this flag is specified.

This functionality only exists in stable/liberty show the bug only exists
there, which is why this is going to stable/liberty directly.

Change-Id: I09d6da122b5c878e3d8a1f85b6f661ff8260867d
Closes-Bug: #1554544
Related-Bug: rhbz#1295912

commit_message:
Don't override the private_net settings for the tenant

In stable/liberty branch the overrides with -P don't seem to be
applied by the client (or heat), causing the deployment to fail with:

Cidr 10.0.0.0/8 of subnet 126de4ce-644f-4fb4-84db-3fb6142d8f9c overlaps with cidr 10.0.0.0/24

Change-Id: I5126887ff94f7a48d6b3160353b802539491de04
Depends-On: Ie21282eb8cc0a8767aceb270bb1c892cec51bf73

subject: Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-08 13:43:35.000000000', 'files': ['tests/files/container-file-copy-test.txt', 'tests/test.yml', 'tasks/lxc_cache_preparation.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache

In order to better make use of OpenStack-CI's resources (apt mirrors, etc)
we need to be able to copy configuration files which have been implemented
on the host image into the containers.

This patch provides a facility to do this in a way that provides a new
facility for deployers to use, doesn't affect existing production
environments and is easy for us to consume in gate testing.

A new variable called 'lxc_container_cache_files' is implemented, which
is a list of dictionaries specifying the location of the file on the
deployment system, where to put it in the container cache, and what
attributes to assign the file.

An example of how to use it is included in the role's defaults as a comment.

Change-Id: Ia76b3a791239a07db1cb93636b7d1e23a6a6851c
"}]
commit_message:
Allow a list of files to be copied into the container cache

In order to better make use of OpenStack-CI's resources (apt mirrors, etc)
we need to be able to copy configuration files which have been implemented
on the host image into the containers.

This patch provides a facility to do this in a way that provides a new
facility for deployers to use, doesn't affect existing production
environments and is easy for us to consume in gate testing.

A new variable called 'lxc_container_cache_files' is implemented, which
is a list of dictionaries specifying the location of the file on the
deployment system, where to put it in the container cache, and what
attributes to assign the file.

An example of how to use it is included in the role's defaults as a comment.

Change-Id: Ia76b3a791239a07db1cb93636b7d1e23a6a6851c

commit_message:
deprecate security_group_api config option

This deprecates the security_group_api config option and makes it
respect the new ``use_neutron`` option. This provides a much simpler
and consistent interface for enabling Neutron support in Nova.

Change-Id: I1c2eb51d10ba6370492a911f59370b9870646a38

commit_message:
Add network templates for multiple NIC configuration

This change adds a set of network interface configurations for use
with network isolation. The multiple-nics templates includes one
separate NIC per network, and assumes that nic1 is used for the
provisioning network (ctlplane). Also included is an environment
file for including the multiple-nics configuration in a deployment.

This revision changes the ordering of the NICs. By doing that, it
is possible to wire up only a subset of the NICs for the storage
nodes, and it is possilbe to leave the External NIC only configured
on the controllers.

rdo: Updated this commit for static control plane configuration

gfidente: Includes Iabd835724848d754d5522968e1c8e3cf9f78e6c6 to
pass pep8 testing.

Co-Authored-By: Rhys Oxenham <roxenham@redhat.com>
Depends-On: Ie21282eb8cc0a8767aceb270bb1c892cec51bf73
Depends-On: Ia2a10318de47854a9b8932d72243ce0a85603556
Depends-On: I5126887ff94f7a48d6b3160353b802539491de04
Change-Id: Ic878d1ed1a85b5705295d087a743570ca8213504
(cherry picked from commit 6c57eab4c29cca7a80c13eae83b6126513621e4d)

Also register license as context function

With that, it's also possible to use:

{{ license('Apache-2.0') }}

instead of the license filter.

commit_message:
Add a deprecation warning to the DB downgrade

DB downgrade doesn't be supported in OpenStack now. Glance will
remove it in N release. In M cycle, we should add a warning to users.

Closes-bug: #1501233
Implements: blueprint remove-db-downgrade
Change-Id: I2791d8421abc0ad6c4905d5ddaa3fa99f264e333

Mistral cannot parse configure file from command line
like this:
--config-file="/path/to/config_file"

So update the code to recognize configure file rightly.

commit_message:
Fix the problem when parse config file

Mistral cannot parse configure file from command line
like this:
--config-file="/path/to/config_file"

So update the code to recognize configure file rightly.

Change-Id: I9f3c23d0437578c9714019c480785198c940d181
Closes-Bug: #1552146

commit_message:
Make add_metrics_to_list side-effect free

It's odd that add_metrics_to_list takes a list only to extend it.
It's simpler to return a list (actually a MonitorMetricList) and
let the calling code do whatever it wants with it.

Refactored add_metrics_to_list into get_metric_objects which
returns a new list of metric objects.

Change-Id: Iec8e41c6f92184511e53da84df160ef9f4d6236c

commit_message:
Add use_default_subnetpool to subnet create requests

This follows up [1] by adding an extension to allow requesting the
default subnet pool explicitly through the API thus restoring the
convenience that was lost by removing the automatic default subnetpool
fallback behavior.

ApiImpact

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/279378/

Change-Id: Ifff57c0485e4727f352b2cc2bd1bdaabd0f1606b
Related-Bug: #1545199
Closes-Bug: #1547705

subject: Make AllNodesExtraConfig depend on the validation deployments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 21:16:45.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud.yaml'], 'message': 'Make AllNodesExtraConfig depend on the validation deployments

AllNodesExtraConfig should really only run after the validation
deployments are done, which validate that basic networking is
functioning.

In particular, creating a swap file during AllNodesExtraConfig while the
validation deployments are still running might cause temporary network
outages which could fail the validations.

Change-Id: Ia2a10318de47854a9b8932d72243ce0a85603556
Partial-Bug: #1553243
(cherry picked from commit 0951c6e359edd2d34cd2bbd6a12278454a905258)
'}]
commit_message:
Make AllNodesExtraConfig depend on the validation deployments

AllNodesExtraConfig should really only run after the validation
deployments are done, which validate that basic networking is
functioning.

In particular, creating a swap file during AllNodesExtraConfig while the
validation deployments are still running might cause temporary network
outages which could fail the validations.

Change-Id: Ia2a10318de47854a9b8932d72243ce0a85603556
Partial-Bug: #1553243
(cherry picked from commit 0951c6e359edd2d34cd2bbd6a12278454a905258)

revisions:

When listing events for a stack using Orchestration API v1, in the Request
Parameters table, the type of 'marker' parameter is "xsd:string".
Actually, it must be "String".
This patch updates the type of 'marker' parameter from "xsd:string" to String.

Change-Id: I758a7cc2c52d43b5db7a2b57567d8899e8d65c22
Closes-Bug: #1553021
'}]
commit_message:
[Orchestration API v1] Fixes the type of "marker (Optional)" parameter

When listing events for a stack using Orchestration API v1, in the Request
Parameters table, the type of 'marker' parameter is "xsd:string".
Actually, it must be "String".
This patch updates the type of 'marker' parameter from "xsd:string" to String.

Change-Id: I758a7cc2c52d43b5db7a2b57567d8899e8d65c22
Closes-Bug: #1553021

commit_message:
Switch to testr from pytest

Align to the other Openstack project and
use testr instead of pytest

    - pylint and pep8 fixes.
    - py34 compliance
    - requirements updated
    - updated path to dsvm gate job

The v2 Image Member Create schema has only ever accepted member_id as a

commit_message:
Accept member_id in v2 Image Member Create

The v2 Image Member Create schema has only ever accepted member_id as a
value in the POST body. The documented POST body and the request
deserializer, however, only ever looked for member. This adds support
for member_id without breaking the existing usage of member. This also
chooses to prefer member_id to member if both are provided

APIImpact
DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Kamil Rykowski <kamil.rykowski@intel.com>
Closes-bug: #1526991

Change-Id: Ia0c677de3ea585c3d4aee5b81b7621d05042001c

commit_message:
VMware: Add vmware-limits metadata definitions

This patch adds the following metadata definitions (image and flavor)
for vmware-limits feature.

disk_io_reservation, disk_io_limit, disk_io_shares_share,
disk_io_shares_level, vif_reservation, vif_limit, vif_shares_share,
vif_shares_level, memory_reservation, memory_limit, memory_shares_share,
memory_shares_level, cpu_reservation, cpu_limit, cpu_shares_share,
cpu_shares_level

UpgradeImpact
OS::Compute::VMwareQuotaFlavor namespace is deprecated.
The properties "quota:cpu_limit" and "quota:cpu_reservation"
are now moved under OS::Compute::VMwareQuota namespace.

DocImpact
New metadata namespace "OS::Compute::VMwareQuota" added.
Release notes added in this patch itself.

Depends-On: I5e955ec7da038dff54f00b2534667a5d69b7d9f3
Change-Id: I24dc4965d0888098dc91ca1e82d3f5b6cde29a9e
Fixes-Bug: #1517643

commit_message:
Validate string limit for input parameter

If property name with more than 255 characters is passed during
image create/update, then it raises 500 error to user.

Added a check to validate string limit and return 400 if it exceeds
the limit.

ApiImpact: For image create/update 400 response will be returned.

Partial-Bug: 1465510
Change-Id: I75f3316a1b9f433abf049fbc69aa5f597398ca50

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2015-10-28 18:44:38.000000000', 'files': ['glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadef_api/property.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/models_metadef.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadef_api/resource_type_association.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadef_api/object.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadef_api/tag.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'glance/tests/functional/db/base_metadef.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadef_api/resource_type.py', 'glance/db/sqlalchemy/metadef_api/namespace.py'], 'message': 'Metadef ORM classes should use a common delete for consistency

The metadef db delete functions typically have code like this:
session.delete(db_rec)
session.flush()

To be consistent with the ORM classes save() function
implementation, it would be better to add a delete function
to the base metadef ORM class (i.e., GlanceMetadefBase).

Background - Both GlanceBase and GlanceMetadefBase ORM classes
call oslo.db.sqlalchemy.models.ModelBase.save() for create/update.
There is no function for hard deletes in ModelBase.

The ModelBase.save function is simply:
def save(self, session)
    with session.begin(subtransactions=True):
        session.add(self)
        session.flush()
Note: See comments in ModelBase.save for more details.

Changes -
1. The GlanceMetadefBase.delete() function was added
and is patterned after the oslo ModelBase.save() function.
2. Metadef ORM delete functions were modified to use
db_rec.delete(session=session).
3. In namespace.py, the delete function was removed as
only delete_cascade is supported.
4. In resource_type.py, the delete function was modified
to explicitly look to see if the resource_type is still
used in a namespace association rather than trying to
check for a specific db exception which might indicate
this condition.

Change-Id: Icb7df8fc9edc3f80fcd681365c5a295d72817e95
Closes-Bug: 1371837
'}]
commit_message:
Metadef ORM classes should use a common delete for consistency

The metadef db delete functions typically have code like this:
session.delete(db_rec)
session.flush()

To be consistent with the ORM classes save() function
implementation, it would be better to add a delete function
to the base metadef ORM class (i.e., GlanceMetadefBase).

Background - Both GlanceBase and GlanceMetadefBase ORM classes
call oslo.db.sqlalchemy.models.ModelBase.save() for create/update.
There is no function for hard deletes in ModelBase.

The ModelBase.save function is simply:
def save(self, session)
    with session.begin(subtransactions=True):
        session.add(self)
        session.flush()
Note: See comments in ModelBase.save for more details.

Changes -
1. The GlanceMetadefBase.delete() function was added
and is patterned after the oslo ModelBase.save() function.
2. Metadef ORM delete functions were modified to use
db_rec.delete(session=session).
3. In namespace.py, the delete function was removed as
only delete_cascade is supported.
4. In resource_type.py, the delete function was modified
to explicitly look to see if the resource_type is still
used in a namespace association rather than trying to
check for a specific db exception which might indicate
this condition.

Change-Id: Icb7df8fc9edc3f80fcd681365c5a295d72817e95
Closes-Bug: 1371837

subject: Move lockutils-wrapper into .testr.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 22:17:29.000000000', 'files': ['.testr.conf', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Move lockutils-wrapper into .testr.conf

Without this the wrapper is not present when running testr directly,
which should be supported. As far as I know there's no intent for
multiple test backends to be working with each others files, they all
start separate servers etc, so having separate lock contexts for them
all should be fine. If this is not the case - well, -1 the patch, but
I think that would indicate very poor isolation hygiene in the test
suite and we'd want to fix that. Ideally the lock stuff would be
within the Python code, but I wanted to fix the immediate issue.

Change-Id: Ib547d8b62b97e6dd58703422b34dd7ffef811b5d
"}]
commit_message:
Move lockutils-wrapper into .testr.conf

Without this the wrapper is not present when running testr directly,
which should be supported. As far as I know there's no intent for
multiple test backends to be working with each others files, they all
start separate servers etc, so having separate lock contexts for them
all should be fine. If this is not the case - well, -1 the patch, but
I think that would indicate very poor isolation hygiene in the test
suite and we'd want to fix that. Ideally the lock stuff would be
within the Python code, but I wanted to fix the immediate issue.

Change-Id: Ib547d8b62b97e6dd58703422b34dd7ffef811b5d

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-07 22:19:56.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/core.py'], 'message': 'Race condition in keystone domain config

This bug fixes a race condition in the domains_config
decorator. The race condition occurs when more than
one thread accesses the decorator. The first thread
sets the configured flag to True before proceeding with
driver load leading the second thread to use the default
driver. This fix ensures that the second thread waits for
the first thread to finish configuration before it uses
the driver.

Change-Id: I0289a4d38e0d30d39c67e29bf77b0a89d1dd23f6
Closes-Bug: 1549726
'}]
commit_message:
Race condition in keystone domain config

This bug fixes a race condition in the domains_config
decorator. The race condition occurs when more than
one thread accesses the decorator. The first thread
sets the configured flag to True before proceeding with
driver load leading the second thread to use the default
driver. This fix ensures that the second thread waits for
the first thread to finish configuration before it uses
the driver.

Change-Id: I0289a4d38e0d30d39c67e29bf77b0a89d1dd23f6
Closes-Bug: 1549726

commit_message:
Extend FakeCryptoCertificate.cert_not_valid_after to 2 hours

Someone reported this test failing on a slow CI system where
it takes 1.5 hours for their stuff to run. It doesn't seem to
matter what our fake mock expiration time is, so bump it to 2
hours.

Change-Id: I0121fe9da5831d6186bf7954271b79a8b3a60eba
Closes-Bug: #1548724

commit_message:
Install: Neutron updates for Mitaka

Update neutron content for Mitaka.

1) Change 'public' to 'provider' and 'private' to
   'self-service' to improve distinction between these
   networks using neutronish terms.
2) Remove explicit installation of some packages due to
   dependency fixes.
3) Remove explicit configuration of verbosity.
4) Remove explicit configuration of ARP spoofing protection.
5) Remove extraneous configuration for the metadata agent.
6) Remove extraneous configuration for nova-neutron
   interaction.
7) Reduce discussion of MTU because Mitaka fixes most
   of the issues, but we still need to explain the
   most limitation of overlay networks.
8) Generally improve wording.

Implements: blueprint installguide-mitaka
Change-Id: I3beff125b2eb8d264048530dc3bad7d346d2828b
