commit_message:
Cap bashate and fix linters tests

Bashate is pinned to ensure that for the rest of the cycle, and
once this becomes a stable branch, there are no code changes
needed for updates to the linting tool.

Also, the tox configuration is updated to ensure that it consumes
the dev-requirements file for all lint testing.

Finally, a H404 & H405 PEP8 violation is resolved in a python
script.

Change-Id: I78056d1d22228f073c44e9ee4e78534a4010effe
(cherry picked from commit 13bea329896c82a8352633038090f31e09ef7afd)

commit_message:
Cap bashate and fix linters tests

Bashate is pinned to ensure that for the rest of the cycle, and
once this becomes a stable branch, there are no code changes
needed for updates to the linting tool.

Also, the tox configuration is updated to ensure that it consumes
the dev-requirements file for all lint testing.

Change-Id: I78056d1d22228f073c44e9ee4e78534a4010effe

revisions:

this may be too small to be useful. This patch checks disqualifies disks
that are smaller than the minimum.

It also sets the minimum to the proper value of 60GB free on the root
disk or 60GB available on the designated secondary disk. The previous
check was 60GB on root and 80GB on the secondary disk which is not
the intented check as noted in the documentation.

commit_message:
Check correct minimum size for data disk

Currently we choose the largest available disk as the data disk, however
this may be too small to be useful. This patch checks disqualifies disks
that are smaller than the minimum.

It also sets the minimum to the proper value of 60GB free on the root
disk or 60GB available on the designated secondary disk. The previous
check was 60GB on root and 80GB on the secondary disk which is not
the intented check as noted in the documentation.

(cherry picked from commit ec14005f7608727896ac21877679d825b557a75a)

Conflicts:
	tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/check-requirements.yml

Change-Id: Id225dc55068e1eed2e19e1e27b0f626163f03db2

commit_message:
In the service lock, reset the service, not the lock

It turns out that when you're in a context manager that has gotten the
lock, attempting to set that lock to None will fail. It's also not the
thing we actually want to do. What we WANT to do is reset the _service_
so that we'll ensure a new service object gets created.

Change-Id: Ic39ef0418dcd5c0cbbe710ac1c31e58b744f56b5

commit_message:
Remove a vol in error state from a CG

Before calling update_consistencygroup, a validation is done if volumes
are in valid states for action.

Divide the states allowed for adding and removing volumes from a CG,
and allow volume removal in states error and error_deleting.

Also added missing verification in manager update_consistencygroup in
case state has changed from cinder-api to cinder-volume.

Change-Id: I6f5fa8e9af67e17ab49e7f3423d4469640df790c
Closes-Bug: #1519377

subject: Change the private subnet of the overcloud tenant network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 00:54:42.000000000', 'files': ['templates/tenantvm_floatingip.yaml'], 'message': "Change the private subnet of the overcloud tenant network

We use 10.0.0.0/24 as the default subnet for the overcloud external
network; the recent change to enable netiso in CI [1] is setting
10.0.0.0/24 as the default floating network for the overcloud,
so that we can ping float Ips from the undercloud (which has a leg
on the external network).

We can't use 10.0.0.0/8 as the private subnet for the overcloud tenant
though network as it conflicts with the floating network, causing errors
like:

Cidr 10.0.0.0/8 of subnet 126de4ce-644f-4fb4-84db-3fb6142d8f9c overlaps with cidr 10.0.0.0/24

This change switches the overcloud tenant network subnet to
192.168.2.0/24 so that it won't conflict.

1. I830755d7d882d155813c105dff76900e6675cca2

Change-Id: Ie21282eb8cc0a8767aceb270bb1c892cec51bf73
(cherry picked from commit 2938259327a1312c107aaa7349ec60d50334c95b)
"}]
commit_message:
Change the private subnet of the overcloud tenant network

We use 10.0.0.0/24 as the default subnet for the overcloud external
network; the recent change to enable netiso in CI [1] is setting
10.0.0.0/24 as the default floating network for the overcloud,
so that we can ping float Ips from the undercloud (which has a leg
on the external network).

We can't use 10.0.0.0/8 as the private subnet for the overcloud tenant
though network as it conflicts with the floating network, causing errors
like:

Cidr 10.0.0.0/8 of subnet 126de4ce-644f-4fb4-84db-3fb6142d8f9c overlaps with cidr 10.0.0.0/24

This change switches the overcloud tenant network subnet to
192.168.2.0/24 so that it won't conflict.

1. I830755d7d882d155813c105dff76900e6675cca2

Change-Id: Ie21282eb8cc0a8767aceb270bb1c892cec51bf73
(cherry picked from commit 2938259327a1312c107aaa7349ec60d50334c95b)

subject: Bypass repo server if missing pip upgrade packages
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7217, 'name': 'Hugh Saunders', 'email': 'hugh@wherenow.org', 'username': 'hughsaunders'}, {'_account_id': 12807, 'name': 'Steve Lewis (stevelle)', 'email': 'stevelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevelle'}, {'_account_id': 12892, 'name': 'Nolan Brubaker', 'email': 'nolan.brubaker@rackspace.com', 'username': 'nrb'}, {'_account_id': 15993, 'name': 'Amy Marrich', 'display_name': 'Amy Marrich (spotz)', 'email': 'amy@demarco.com', 'username': 'amarrich'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-08 04:24:14.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/scripts-library.sh'], 'message': 'Bypass repo server if missing pip upgrade packages

The function get_pip upgrades the pip packages for pip. If OSA is
updated to require newer versions these may not be present on the repo
server and this will cause bootstrap-ansible.sh to fail.

Update the get_pip function to fallback on calling pip with the
--isolated flag when pip is installed and the pip packages are being
upgraded.

Change-Id: Ifa644b9bf6aa8b20028eb0257c40fe20f3ab1a3b
'}]
commit_message:
Bypass repo server if missing pip upgrade packages

The function get_pip upgrades the pip packages for pip. If OSA is
updated to require newer versions these may not be present on the repo
server and this will cause bootstrap-ansible.sh to fail.

Update the get_pip function to fallback on calling pip with the
--isolated flag when pip is installed and the pip packages are being
upgraded.

Change-Id: Ifa644b9bf6aa8b20028eb0257c40fe20f3ab1a3b

When we install mesos if it(or some deps) doesn't find java it installs
gcj(java5) which generate cacerts, so later in marathon we have
situation that openjdk8 can't access(discover as broken) to it because
of different format. Additionaly this third-party openjdk8 has in
dependencies ca-certificates-java which need java to generate cacerts

Closes-bug: #1552626

commit_message:
Fix ubuntu marathon container

When we install mesos if it(or some deps) doesn't find java it installs
gcj(java5) which generate cacerts, so later in marathon we have
situation that openjdk8 can't access(discover as broken) to it because
of different format. Additionaly this third-party openjdk8 has in
dependencies ca-certificates-java which need java to generate cacerts
file.

Change-Id: Ic4467529a842ffc4bdd99ac1e23abbdee3a82422
Closes-bug: #1552626

subject: Do not reveal auth token in swiftclient log messages by default
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-26 14:46:44.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/shell.py', 'tests/unit/test_swiftclient.py', 'swiftclient/client.py', 'tests/unit/utils.py'], 'message': "Do not reveal auth token in swiftclient log messages by default

Currently the swiftclient logs sensitive info in headers when logging
HTTP requests. This patch hides sensitive info in headers such as
'X-Auth-Token' in a similar way to swift itself (we add a
'reveal_sensitive_prefix' configuration to the client).

With this patch, tokens are truncated by removing the specified number
of characters, after which '...' is appended to the logged token to
indicate that it has been redacted.

Also include client.parse_header_string() for safe unicode handling
of header data.

Backport based on commits:

  c3f06417049e17a8d45ee5926c5043cb6c8aa9ef
  4d44dcf36086add13d3353915c014f095ab99c6d
  ce569f46517e10f2ce0d27e9ee0a922ad1d84e2f

Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>

Change-Id: I43dd7254f7281d4db59b286aa2145643c64e1705
Closes-bug: #1516692
"}]
commit_message:
Do not reveal auth token in swiftclient log messages by default

Currently the swiftclient logs sensitive info in headers when logging
HTTP requests. This patch hides sensitive info in headers such as
'X-Auth-Token' in a similar way to swift itself (we add a
'reveal_sensitive_prefix' configuration to the client).

With this patch, tokens are truncated by removing the specified number
of characters, after which '...' is appended to the logged token to
indicate that it has been redacted.

Also include client.parse_header_string() for safe unicode handling
of header data.

Backport based on commits:

  c3f06417049e17a8d45ee5926c5043cb6c8aa9ef
  4d44dcf36086add13d3353915c014f095ab99c6d
  ce569f46517e10f2ce0d27e9ee0a922ad1d84e2f

Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistair.coles@hpe.com>
Co-Authored-By: Li Cheng <shcli@cn.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Zack M. Davis <zdavis@swiftstack.com>

Change-Id: I43dd7254f7281d4db59b286aa2145643c64e1705
Closes-bug: #1516692

commit_message:
Quote control plane mask length

Because this value is used in a string concatenation operation in
the templates, it needs to be explicitly a string.  If it's not,
you get an error like:

"output_error": "Items to join must be strings not 24"

from the nested Heat stack.

Change-Id: I47833c4d5fabeeff49d25dce77519dff49b0f461

commit_message:
Remove deprecated 'script' and 'interpreter' in favor of 'command'

VM task scenarios executes a script with a interpreter provided through
a formatted argument called 'command' which expects the remote_path or local_path
of the script and optionally an interpreter with which the script has to be
executed.

Change-Id: If2e65b553a0f26180267ef0b8e2239e3efe4ea17

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-07 14:23:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_quota.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py'], 'message': 'Add Base64 decode validation in API

As demonstrated in Nova API ref, user should encode
their injected file content with base64 encoding before
use it.

But yet we are lack of validation of whether it is
correctely encoded, and it will pass down to
nova/compute/manager for decoding [1]. If the
provided content failed to decode, Base64DecodeError
will raise but yet not handled, this will also cause
the async problem of scheduler and compute.

This patch  add validate of base64 decode in the API
layer since in this way we can save the cost for
performing the rest of booting jobs such as scheduling
etc.

[1]
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/compute/manager.py#n1910

Change-Id: If3068214e7878cb8b78d53143405c4ec2d9cc5e8
Closes-Bug: #1553921
'}]
commit_message:
Add Base64 decode validation in API

As demonstrated in Nova API ref, user should encode
their injected file content with base64 encoding before
use it.

But yet we are lack of validation of whether it is
correctely encoded, and it will pass down to
nova/compute/manager for decoding [1]. If the
provided content failed to decode, Base64DecodeError
will raise but yet not handled, this will also cause
the async problem of scheduler and compute.

This patch  add validate of base64 decode in the API
layer since in this way we can save the cost for
performing the rest of booting jobs such as scheduling
etc.

[1]
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/compute/manager.py#n1910

Change-Id: If3068214e7878cb8b78d53143405c4ec2d9cc5e8
Closes-Bug: #1553921

commit_message:
Adding option disable-exec to freezer-scheduler

Allow freezer-scheduler to disable execution of commands. Running
freezer-scheduler with --disable-exec option, if the task contains
action: exec all actions in this job won't be executed.

Change-Id: I0b60f3957571ee56343cd7685c2b76ffe892bb7f
Implements: blueprint disable-exec-option

[{'number': 33, 'created': '2016-02-08 10:55:26.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/constants.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_conf.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_huawei_drivers.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/rest_client.py', 'releasenotes/notes/support-replication-for-huawei-volume-driver-ad61e9f5eba9c422.yaml', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/replication.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_driver.py'], 'message': "Huawei: Implement v2 replication (managed)

This patch implements the managed side of v2 replication in the
HuaweiDriver. Both Synchronous mode and Asynchronous mode are
supported with Huawei arrays. The volume type need to associate with
the extra spec with 'replication_enabled' equaling to '<is> True', and
'replication_type' equaling to '<in> sync' or '<in> async'. If
'replication_type' is not provided, it will be defaulted to
Asynchronous mode.

What are supported with replication:
1. create volume
2. create volume from snapshot
3. clone a volume
4. create volume from image
5. volume retype
6. volume migration

configure a replication local backend and a replication remote backend
as follows:

[replica]
volume_driver =
    cinder.volume.drivers.huawei.huawei_driver.HuaweiISCSIDriver
cinder_huawei_conf_file = /etc/cinder/cinder_huawei_conf.xml
volume_backend_name = replica

    san_user:admin,san_password:passwd

[replica-remote]
volume_driver =
    cinder.volume.drivers.huawei.huawei_driver.HuaweiISCSIDriver
cinder_huawei_conf_file = /etc/cinder/cinder_huawei_conf_remote.xml
volume_backend_name = replica-remote
replication_device = target_device_id:huawei-replica-2,
    managed_backend_name:host@replica#pool,

Implements: blueprint support-replication-for-huawei-volume-driver

commit_message:
Huawei: Implement v2 replication (managed)

This patch implements the managed side of v2 replication in the
HuaweiDriver. Both Synchronous mode and Asynchronous mode are
supported with Huawei arrays. The volume type need to associate with
the extra spec with 'replication_enabled' equaling to '<is> True', and
'replication_type' equaling to '<in> sync' or '<in> async'. If
'replication_type' is not provided, it will be defaulted to
Asynchronous mode.

What are supported with replication:
1. create volume
2. create volume from snapshot
3. clone a volume
4. create volume from image
5. volume retype
6. volume migration

So far we support a single remote device, and 'cinder.conf' should
configure a replication local backend and a replication remote backend
as follows:

[replica]
volume_driver =
    cinder.volume.drivers.huawei.huawei_driver.HuaweiISCSIDriver
cinder_huawei_conf_file = /etc/cinder/cinder_huawei_conf.xml
volume_backend_name = replica
replication_device = target_device_id:huawei-replica-1,
    managed_backend_name:host@replica-remote#pool,
    san_address:san_url_1;san_url_2,
    san_user:admin,san_password:passwd

[replica-remote]
volume_driver =
    cinder.volume.drivers.huawei.huawei_driver.HuaweiISCSIDriver
cinder_huawei_conf_file = /etc/cinder/cinder_huawei_conf_remote.xml
volume_backend_name = replica-remote
replication_device = target_device_id:huawei-replica-2,
    managed_backend_name:host@replica#pool,
    san_address:san_url_1;san_url_2,
    san_user:admin,san_password:passwd

Change-Id: Iaa3834547f80e7687f7e1946cb10d35f9ff0c136
Implements: blueprint support-replication-for-huawei-volume-driver

commit_message:
[Identity] Check return value is None in identity v3 unit tests

take_action() in commands inheriting from Command returns nothing.
So we should assert the return is None in the unit tests of these
commands.

Change-Id: I02af06b3d476aac2d93a23ef2111cdc7fa0892ec
Partial-Bug: #1550636

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-06 13:40:02.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-network/server-config.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/openstack-network/plugins/ml2.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/openstack-network/server-config_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Do not overwite DAEMON_ARGS for services

DAEMON_ARGS should not be overwritten completely, as this will cause issues
with services that use DAEMON_ARGS in init scripts. Instead DAEMON_ARGS should

commit_message:
Do not overwite DAEMON_ARGS for services

DAEMON_ARGS should not be overwritten completely, as this will cause issues
with services that use DAEMON_ARGS in init scripts. Instead DAEMON_ARGS should
be extended

Change-Id: I29f09c105c6ff7dae3ba7bc4a933da613523dc34
Closes-bug: #1553717

commit_message:
Fix warning when running tox

When running tox it would print out a warning:

  WARNING:test command found but not installed in testenv
    cmd: /usr/bin/find
    env: /opt/stack/keystone/.tox/py27
  Maybe you forgot to specify a dependency? See also the whitelist_externals envconfig setting.

This is because we forgot to specify a dependency.

Change-Id: I4270c52213159cefa04a63979ee0bb2e1a2fa35f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 6717, 'name': 'Jakub Ruzicka', 'email': 'jruzicka@redhat.com', 'username': 'jruzicka'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 7613, 'name': 'Igor Yozhikov', 'email': 'medput@gmail.com', 'username': 'iyozhikov'}, {'_account_id': 10384, 'name': 'Haïkel Guémar', 'email': 'hguemar@fedoraproject.org', 'username': 'hguemar'}, {'_account_id': 13404, 'name': 'Alberto Planas', 'email': 'aplanas@gmail.com', 'username': 'aplanas'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 07:13:45.000000000', 'files': ['renderspec/__init__.py', 'tests.py'], 'message': 'Add filter and contextfunction for epoch

Epoch handling for package versions is already supported. But
for handling the epoch field, the plain epoch number is needed.
There is now a new context function called "epoch" (and also
a filter with the same name is added) to handle the epoch.
Example (first one recommended):

Epoch: {{ epoch('oslo.config' }}

or:

Epoch: {{ 'oslo.config' | epoch }}

Both will render to:

Epoch: 2

if there's a epoch.yaml file where the epoch for oslo.config is set to
2.
If the epoch.yaml file is not there, the epoch will be set to 0.

Change-Id: I1aea2bce426b5d1bf105cb177367ce9f74c20a0b
'}]
commit_message:
Add filter and contextfunction for epoch

Epoch handling for package versions is already supported. But
for handling the epoch field, the plain epoch number is needed.
There is now a new context function called "epoch" (and also
a filter with the same name is added) to handle the epoch.
Example (first one recommended):

Epoch: {{ epoch('oslo.config' }}

or:

Epoch: {{ 'oslo.config' | epoch }}

Both will render to:

Epoch: 2

if there's a epoch.yaml file where the epoch for oslo.config is set to
2.
If the epoch.yaml file is not there, the epoch will be set to 0.

Change-Id: I1aea2bce426b5d1bf105cb177367ce9f74c20a0b

commit_message:
Fix event_type creationg failure due to race condition

Race condition exists when 2 threads try to create same event_type, so
need detect it and load the event_type again.

Change-Id: If3439817cfbfef90daeb5975338909f8312864c4
Closes-Bug: #1254800

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 10:07:17.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_object_storage.sh'], 'message': 'Fixup for unbound variable in swift upgrade script heredoc

The variables in the heredoc are included when we set -u so we get
unbound variables for $1 and then $S etc. Temporarily set +u before

Change-Id: I815216a7260ebf53c234b3e1f4450fdfe8e77f04
'}]
commit_message:
Fixup for unbound variable in swift upgrade script heredoc

The variables in the heredoc are included when we set -u so we get
unbound variables for $1 and then $S etc. Temporarily set +u before
and after the heredoc.

Change-Id: I815216a7260ebf53c234b3e1f4450fdfe8e77f04

commit_message:
Single/Multinode VPNaaS Scenario Tests using Rally

(a) Refactored the code to work with the following cases
    1. Single node with DVR
    2. Single node without DVR
    3. Multinode with DVR
    4. Multinode without DVR
|-------------|-------------------------------------------------------|
|             |                Single Node/ Multinode Tests           |
| Scenarios   |-------------------------------------------------------|
|             | DVR | DVR+Concurrency | Non DVR | Non DVR+Concurrency |

| Vpn Basic   |  x  |      x          |    x    |         x           |
| Multi Tenant|  x  |      x          |    x    |         x           |
| Vpn Status  |  x  |      x          |    x    |         x           |
|-------------|-----|-----------------|---------|---------------------|

(b) Used the paramiko package to execute commands over ssh.

(c) Moved the README to devref

subject: Introduce Overcloud Log Aggregation
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-04 17:32:14.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'controller.yaml', 'compute.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_compute.pp', 'puppet/compute-puppet.yaml', 'puppet/hieradata/compute.yaml', 'puppet/hieradata/common.yaml', 'puppet/hieradata/controller.yaml', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'message': "Introduce Overcloud Log Aggregation

This commit introduces overcloud log aggregation to puppet-based
installs, using fluentd as a collection agent.

The requisite packages and puppet modules should already
have been installed by the 'overcloud-logging' element in
tripleo-puppet-elements.

The installed fluentd instance will forward collected logs to the
fluentd instance on the given log aggregation server.  To enable this,
use the `LogAggregationServer` parameter on the compute and controller
templates (either through a Tuskar plan or the
'overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml' template).  This parameter should contain
the IP address or hostname of the main log aggregation server
(e.g. the undercloud).

Depends-On: I87524bc81621d7a1c4a1ab8f7c6ac049b1443371
Change-Id: Ic0af2ca635e7dad27945fcbee2df8afe2c72a83c
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce Overcloud Log Aggregation

This commit introduces overcloud log aggregation to puppet-based
installs, using fluentd as a collection agent.

The requisite packages and puppet modules should already
have been installed by the 'overcloud-logging' element in
tripleo-puppet-elements.

The installed fluentd instance will forward collected logs to the
fluentd instance on the given log aggregation server.  To enable this,
use the `LogAggregationServer` parameter on the compute and controller
templates (either through a Tuskar plan or the
'overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml' template).  This parameter should contain
the IP address or hostname of the main log aggregation server
(e.g. the undercloud).

Depends-On: I87524bc81621d7a1c4a1ab8f7c6ac049b1443371
Change-Id: Ic0af2ca635e7dad27945fcbee2df8afe2c72a83c

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8399, 'name': 'Jay Dobies', 'email': 'jason.dobies@redhat.com', 'username': 'jdob'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-07 07:46:44.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/all-nodes-config.yaml'], 'message': "Fixup the memcached servers string in nova.conf for v6

As discussed at https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1299265
when providing a list of IPv6 addresses as the memcache_node_ips
the resulting nova.conf entry can't be parsed properly.

This adds a memcache_node_ips_v6 which has the required format like
inet6:[ADDR1],inet6:[ADDR2],inet6:[ADDR3]

Closes-Bug: 1536103
Change-Id: I7f95fa063cbba279c4c2e270841f0a279d2be2f6
"}]
commit_message:
Fixup the memcached servers string in nova.conf for v6

As discussed at https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1299265
when providing a list of IPv6 addresses as the memcache_node_ips
the resulting nova.conf entry can't be parsed properly.

This adds a memcache_node_ips_v6 which has the required format like
inet6:[ADDR1],inet6:[ADDR2],inet6:[ADDR3]

Closes-Bug: 1536103
Change-Id: I7f95fa063cbba279c4c2e270841f0a279d2be2f6

commit_message:
Fix auth_url for cinder configuration

This fix configures the auth_url parameter to use keystone_service_adminurl
over the existing keystone_service_adminuri parameter which actually leads
to a incomplete URL lacking the API version like /v3/tokens

Change-Id: Ib2f47cb62bd9098fa2e7335f7f776b525da71ac3
Related-Bug: #1552394

subject: swift: use bulk deletes
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-07 20:04:59.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/tests/base.py', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'gnocchi/storage/swift.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': 'swift: use bulk deletes

we read and write a lot of data constantly. swift supports deleting
objects in bulk[1] so we should leverage this so we can minimise
the number of calls we make to delete objects. this can save
potentially thousands of calls depending on backlog size.

this adds a requirement to configure swift with bulk-filter middleware.

Change-Id: I13afc90d7f67b3d7f213f48f92fc76a1f544861b
'}]
commit_message:
swift: use bulk deletes

we read and write a lot of data constantly. swift supports deleting
objects in bulk[1] so we should leverage this so we can minimise
the number of calls we make to delete objects. this can save
potentially thousands of calls depending on backlog size.

this adds a requirement to configure swift with bulk-filter middleware.

Change-Id: I13afc90d7f67b3d7f213f48f92fc76a1f544861b

commit_message:
Revert "functional: Grab the service version from the module"

This reverts commit d411d60587e54dd364b7a329035726f2e281a9f7.

The point of doc/*samples* is they are static files, not
dynamic. We shouldn't be doing substitution here, this
breaks all kinds of things, including the doc target.

Change-Id: Iaaf9fa0096ab62e6d3efbe018d8d4853a2ff8cda
Closes-Bug: #1553634

commit_message:
Resolve name/id using translation rules

This changes the first set of neutron resouces to
use translation rules to resolve name_id properties.

Changed reources:

- OS::Neutron::Subnet
- OS::Neutron::Port
- OS::Neutron::Router
- OS::Neutron::FloatingIp

Change-Id: I13f30abb5e284beff4ece9e0c88ee7319ff1be80
Partial-Bug: #1514680
Closes-Bug: #1553362

subject: Cleanup DataSource Driver only if it has a worker_thread
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-07 10:33:07.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/datasources/test_datasource_driver.py', 'congress/datasources/datasource_driver.py'], 'message': "Cleanup DataSource Driver only if it has a worker_thread

DataSourceDriver tries to delete worker_thread anytime when it deletes
datasources. It will make an error if push-type datasource is deleted
because it usually doesn't have a worker thread.

Closes-Bug: #1553982
Change-Id: I9623d25b4814281ac0f167734c3a1ce489eb0fae
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup DataSource Driver only if it has a worker_thread

DataSourceDriver tries to delete worker_thread anytime when it deletes
datasources. It will make an error if push-type datasource is deleted
because it usually doesn't have a worker thread.

Closes-Bug: #1553982
Change-Id: I9623d25b4814281ac0f167734c3a1ce489eb0fae

commit_message:
Allow deleting gateway interfaces on network topology

We didn't allow to delete a router_gateway interface from a router
in the network topology due to the checking being done
working only on normal interfaces.

Change-Id: I35f7fc7c0050e1441a740a110fb6f45ddec9371d
Closes-Bug: 1548224

commit_message:
Store config in drivers and use it to get list_limit

With domain-specific configs, different drivers will be used for
different domains. Options might be different for these drivers. For
example, user might want to user different list_limit for a domain.

Partial-Bug: 1495669
Change-Id: I706843d7860ec5718c9fbf62af7a65b89b67e4b3

commit_message:
Adding authentication compatibility for OpenStackClient

In ksa, plugins loading is managed by ksa.
OpenStackClient token_endpoint plugin expects get_auth_ref[1],
(a method consistent with ksa auth plugins) which is not implemented
in ksa token_endpoint.

This change will not change overall ksa behavior, as it only makes
OpenStackClient to be able to provide its token_endpoint plugin,
necessary for authentication migration in osc from ksc to ksa[2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/python-openstackclient/blob/
master/openstackclient/api/auth_plugin.py#L48-L50
[2] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/keystoneauth/migrating.html

Change-Id: I7d8f9a9f071a0d37244f8985bd7d09d49ba79eb8
Closes-Bug: 1533369

commit_message:
tempest: use ceilometer client manager instead of tempest one

This patch replaces client manager used in base test class from tempest
one to ceilometer dedicated manager which only has clients used in
ceilometer tests.

The conflicts in config parameter are solved by adding '_plugin' in
paramter names as suffix.

This patch also includes the following changes in tempest.

  - Ie99bbbe7655138c4c3ecae69ae0b361198a9651d
  - I340d96c27f0e906df5b8a109494920e9cd3b21d1
  - I14e16a1a7d9813b324ee40545c07f0e88fb637b7

Closes-Bug: 1549424
Depends-On: Ifc29617743b76b01eb6cd30a375cf47b56e4f635
Change-Id: I97842d2766adcf04139422e7904082317b0583cf
Implements: blueprint tempest-plugin

subject: Add an environment to use a swap partition
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-06 21:06:25.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/all_nodes/swap-partition.yaml'], 'message': "Add an environment to use a swap partition

This environment can be used with AllNodesExtraConfig to enable swap on
a device with the given label as specified by the swap_partition_label
parameter.

If Ironic is used to create the swap partition, the partition will have
a label of swap1, so that's a reasonable default for the parameter.

The partition is also written to /etc/fstab as a swap mount so that it
will be enabled on reboot.

Change-Id: I5cd68c13dbfe53eecf6c6ad93151eadc980a902d
"}]
commit_message:
Add an environment to use a swap partition

This environment can be used with AllNodesExtraConfig to enable swap on
a device with the given label as specified by the swap_partition_label
parameter.

If Ironic is used to create the swap partition, the partition will have
a label of swap1, so that's a reasonable default for the parameter.

The partition is also written to /etc/fstab as a swap mount so that it
will be enabled on reboot.

Change-Id: I5cd68c13dbfe53eecf6c6ad93151eadc980a902d

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 06:24:37.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_common/kafka/producer.py'], 'message': "Partition is not the key

When publising batch messages to kafka
key was assumed to be the same thing as
partition. That lead to errors like

 TopicAndPartition(
   topic='log',
   partition='43243242352352') not available

where partition was current timestamp for instance.
Commit provides selecting the best partition for
given key and using it to publish messages

Change-Id: Id81520af5b3c243f7f9947e00df5fb07f06021fc
"}]
commit_message:
Partition is not the key

When publising batch messages to kafka
key was assumed to be the same thing as
partition. That lead to errors like

 TopicAndPartition(
   topic='log',
   partition='43243242352352') not available

where partition was current timestamp for instance.
Commit provides selecting the best partition for
given key and using it to publish messages

Change-Id: Id81520af5b3c243f7f9947e00df5fb07f06021fc

subject: Add missing setting for cache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 00:52:52.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/source/horizon-install.rst'], 'message': 'Add missing setting for cache

The install guide instructs how to use memcached for a session
store for Horizon. It configures the caches, but does not actually
tell Horizon to use it for sessions. The default is signed-cookies
for sessions not caching.

This patch adds the setting to tell Horizon to use the cache for
sessions.

Change-Id: I7cd2add9df5dd699879dbdd1406495dc03f5267b
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing setting for cache

The install guide instructs how to use memcached for a session
store for Horizon. It configures the caches, but does not actually
tell Horizon to use it for sessions. The default is signed-cookies
for sessions not caching.

This patch adds the setting to tell Horizon to use the cache for
sessions.

Change-Id: I7cd2add9df5dd699879dbdd1406495dc03f5267b

commit_message:
Add a neutron-full variant with fwaas tests from tempest plugins

As experiment for now.
This enables a tempest plugin provided by neutron-fwaas.
Intended to replace neutron-full jobs in a long run.

The REGEX is intentionally restricted to tempest and fwaas
to avoid tempest plugins from random repositories slipping in.

Change-Id: I962a9b60f27b19f5a656c4c259b4d2de45f035d6
